0.title: Venue of KK's concert was overcrowded, bouncers sprayed foam to disperse crowd: Staff
0.article_body: A staff member of Nazrul Mancha Auditorium in Kolkata, who was present during KK's concert, revealed the venue was overcrowded and the bouncers had to spray foam to disperse the crowd. The staff member said that KK was feeling unwell during his performance and added that KK took a break and performed again. KK passed away aged 53 on Tuesday.

1.title: Not my job to question about policies: Akshay Kumar on asking PM Modi if he eats mangoes
1.article_body: Speaking about interviewing Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Akshay Kumar said, "As a common man, I just wanted to ask him very simple, straight questions." On being questioned about asking PM Modi if he eats mangoes during the interview, the actor said, "It's not my job to ask about the policies...It all looks fake if I would do that."

2.title: Congratulatory messages are still coming in: Arshdeep on India call-up
2.article_body: PBKS' 23-year-old pacer Arshdeep Singh, who earned his maiden India call-up for the upcoming five-match T20I series against South Africa, has revealed that he got the news of his selection while travelling for an IPL 2022 game and he "didn't feel much" at that time. "Now, I'm feeling really good as congratulatory messages are still coming in...I'm grateful," he added.

3.title: Mapmaker TomTom to cut 10% of workforce due to improved automation
3.article_body: Mapmaker TomTom has said it will cut 10% of its workforce globally as it steps up its automated mapmaking capability. TomTom CEO Harold Goddijn said higher levels of automation would build better, broader maps enabling it to address a wider market. "Regrettably, this will have an intended impact on approximately 500 employees in our Maps unit," TomTom said.

4.title: Jharkhand govt orders probe into BJP leaders' 'disproportionate assets'
4.article_body: The Jharkhand government ordered a probe into the alleged disproportionate assets of five former ministers of the previous BJP government. This comes after a plea was filed in Jharkhand High Court against the leaders - Amar Bauri, Nilkanth Singh Munda, Neera Yadav, Randhir Singh and Lois Marandi. Their assets grew by up to 1200% in five years, claimed the petition.

5.title: Working on the songs KK sang was always more special: Emraan Hashmi
5.article_body: Emraan Hashmi paid tribute to singer KK on Twitter. "A voice and talent like no other. They don't make them like him anymore. Working on the songs he sang was always that much more special," he tweeted. Emraan featured in several songs sung by KK like 'Beete Lamhein', 'Dil Ibaadat' and 'Zara Sa'. KK, aged 53, passed away on Tuesday.

6.title: People haven't stopped crying after hearing KK's 'Tadap...' for 23 years: Ismail
6.article_body: Discussing the song 'Tadap Tadap Ke' from 'Hum Dil De Chuke Sanam' sung by late singer KK, the film's music director Ismail Darbar said KK was straightforward in admitting he "couldn't" sing it when they first met. Ismail added he was impressed by KK's honesty. "The way KK sang...people haven't stopped crying after hearing it for 23 years," stated Ismail.

7.title: Scientists identify novel disease that affects liver & kidneys together
7.article_body: Scientists have identified a novel inherited disease, TULP3-related ciliopathy that causes kidney and liver failure in children and adults. They have found a faulty gene that acts as catalyst in increasing fibrosis in liver and kidney, resulting in their failure. The findings would help them give patients a precise diagnosis which would facilitate relevant treatment for best possible results.

8.title: New Australian govt includes record 13 women ministers
8.article_body: Australia's new government was sworn in on Wednesday. Of the 30 ministers appointed to the new government, 13 are women. Women also hold a record 10 spots out of 23 in core Cabinet roles. Youth Minister Anne Aly became Australia's first female Muslim minister, while Industry and Science Minister Ed Husic is the first Muslim to serve in Cabinet.

9.title: Yamuna Expressway authority hikes land allotment rates by up to 38%
9.article_body: Yamuna Expressway Industrial Development Authority (YEIDA) has hiked land allotment rates in the area by up to 38% for different categories, officials said. The new rates will be effective from April 2022-23 fiscal and will be applicable in all segments except commercial lands, officials added. This comes in the wake of the work on Noida international airport, officials stated.

10.title: 'Om..' didn't work but KK's spirit for song encouraged me in bad times: Anupam
10.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher took to Instagram to share a video of song from his movie 'Om Jai Jagadish' and said that he can't believe that singer KK, who sang the song, has "left us". "The film didn't work but the spirit with which KK sang this song...always encouraged me in my bad times....Will be missed a lot friend," he wrote.

11.title: I would give the Ballon d'Or to Real Madrid's Vinicius Jr: Neymar
11.article_body: Former Barcelona forward Neymar said he would give the Ballon d'Or for this year to Real Madrid's Brazilian attacker Vinicius Jr. "Kylian Mbappe had a great season, Karim Benzema too," added Neymar. Vinicius scored the winner for Real Madrid in their recent Champions League final against Liverpool, to help his side win the Champions League for a record-extending 14th time.

12.title: Samson reinvented himself in IPL 2022, he played selfless cricket: Saba Karim
12.article_body: Former India wicketkeeper-batter Saba Karim has said RR captain Sanju Samson reinvented himself in the recently-concluded IPL 2022. "Sanju played selfless cricket...I agree there [were] one or two instances where he [didn't score]...runs that were required on the big occasions but the finesse and timing [could be] seen in his batting," explained Karim. Samson scored 458 runs in IPL 2022.

13.title: KK had insisted I sing Aashayein chorus instead of him: Salim Merchant
13.article_body: Composer-singer Salim Merchant paid tribute to singer KK, who passed away on Tuesday at 53. Salim recalled an incident where KK asked Salim to sing the 'Aashayein' chorus instead of him. "KK was the lead singer, but he had the heart...to let me sing an important part," he added. Taking to Twitter, Salim wrote, "I'm speechless...broken with you leaving us...suddenly."

14.title: Central govt selling PSUs, implementing anti-labour laws: TRS leader
14.article_body: TRS leader and Telangana MLC K Kavitha on Tuesday criticised BJP-led central government while accusing it of selling the Public Sector Undertakings (PSUs). Kavitha also accused the Centre of implementing "anti-labour laws" alleging that the Modi government has "duped" public with reforms carried out in its eight years of tenure. "TRS government is fighting against such laws (reforms)," she added.

15.title: Mumbai civic body draws lottery for ward reservation; women get 118 seats
15.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) on Tuesday drew a lottery for reservation of wards for SC, ST and general category seats for women without OBC quota. As many as 118 of 236 BMC seats will be reserved for women. Eight of these seats will be reserved for SC candidates, one seat for ST candidates and 109 for the general category candidates.

16.title: Congress leader Brijesh Kalappa resigns, cites lack of passion
16.article_body: Senior Congress leader and Supreme Court advocate Brijesh Kalappa has resigned from the party. In a letter to Congress chief Sonia Gandhi, Kalappa said, "I have been representing the party on Hindi, English and Kannada channels since the UPA years in 2013." "But, in the recent past, I have been finding myself lacking in passion," he added.

17.title: Ram Mandir will be national temple of India, symbol of country's unity: UP CM
17.article_body: The Ram Mandir being built in Ayodhya will be the "national temple of India", UP CM Yogi Adityanath said on Wednesday. CM Yogi laid the foundation stone for Ram Mandir's Garbhagriha in Ayodhya today. "People have been waiting for this day for a long time. Ram Mandir will be a symbol of India's unity," CM Yogi added.

18.title: I gave my best, lost to a better player: Djokovic after defeat against Nadal
18.article_body: World number one Novak Djokovic said he was proud of the fight he put up against Rafa Nadal in the French Open quarter-final as he lost to a "better player". He added, "Had my chances. Didn't use them...You know, over four hours' battle, and I have to accept this defeat." Nadal won the match 6-2, 4-6, 6-2, 7-6(7-4).

19.title: Pakistani singer Shae Gill gets trolled for post on Sidhu Moosewala; she replies
19.article_body: Pakistani singer Shae Gill, who gained fame after featuring in Coke Studio song 'Pasoori', was trolled on social media for condoling Sidhu Moosewala's death. "As a Muslim, you're not allowed to make dua for non-Muslims when they die," someone messaged her. Gill replied, "I'm a Christian, belong to a Christian family and can make prayers for people from different religions."

20.title: Wanted to quit ODIs when Dhoni dropped me in 2008, Sachin stopped me from retiring: Sehwag
20.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag has revealed that he wanted to quit ODI cricket when MS Dhoni dropped him from the playing XI in a series against Australia in 2008. "I thought I will continue playing only Test cricket. Sachin Tendulkar stopped me at the time. He said, 'This is a bad phase of your life. Just wait'," Sehwag added.

21.title: Death toll from heavy rains in northeast Brazil reaches 106
21.article_body: The death toll from flooding and landslides following heavy rains in northeast Brazil has reached 106, the government said. At least 10 people are still missing. "We'll not stop until we find all those missing," Pernambuco state's Governor, Paulo Camara, said. Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro on Monday flew over the affected areas and pledged support for those who'd been impacted.

22.title: Not fair, how can you just go; a brother is gone: Mohit Chauhan on KK's death
22.article_body: Singer Mohit Chauhan took to Twitter to share his picture with late singer KK to say he is in shock and grief. "KK...not fair man. Not your time to go...How can you just go...A ear dear friend, a brother is gone. RIP KK. Love you," he wrote. Meanwhile, singer Sonu Nigam posted KK's video on Instagram and wrote, "Not done."

23.title: TN BJP chief booked for protesting against fuel prices without permission
23.article_body: A case has been registered against state BJP chief K Annamalai and over 5,000 people for protesting and marching towards the state's Secretariat in Chennai without permission, demanding the government to reduce fuel prices, police officials said. "DMK promised in its manifesto that it will reduce the prices of petrol and diesel by ₹5 and ₹4 respectively," Annamalai added.

24.title: 2 men arrested for running over police officer with car in Gurugram
24.article_body: Gurugram Police arrested two men for allegedly running over a police officer with their car. The incident occurred on Saturday night when assistant sub-inspector Sundar Singh was deployed near Vatika city in Sector-83. Singh spotted and stopped a vehicle coming from the wrong side. He then asked the driver to reverse the car, but the driver instead ran over him.

25.title: Numb & devastated, how could you go like this KK: Shankar Mahadevan
25.article_body: Singer Shankar Mahadevan paid tribute to singer KK after the latter passed away on Tuesday at the age of 53 in Kolkata. Taking to Twitter, Shankar wrote, "Numb...devastated, just can't take this, KK, how could you just go like this...Love you, buddy." Taking to Instagram, singer Kumar Sanu wrote, "Life is so unpredictable. KK was a fit guy."

26.title: 21-yr-old woman, doctor try to sell her baby for ₹3 lakh in Nagpur, 8 arrested
26.article_body: A 21-year-old woman along with seven others, including her husband and a doctor, was arrested in Nagpur for allegedly trying to sell her five-day-old daughter for ₹3 lakh, an official said. The woman didn't want to become a mother at young age so, she contacted the doctor who suggested to give the child to someone after delivery, the official added.

27.title: Few students injured in fight between 2 groups at Delhi's Ramjas college
27.article_body: A few students suffered minor injuries after a brawl broke out between two groups at Delhi's Ramjas college on Tuesday. "Reportedly, one group having affiliation with...Students' Federation of India, edited a caste-based slogan...initially painted by Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad (ABVP) supporters over a wall and changed it to another caste-based slogan," police said.

28.title: Indore to become IT hub of India soon: MP CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan
28.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Tuesday said that Indore will surpass Bengaluru and Hyderabad to become the IT hub of India in the next 10 years. "Around 100 new startup companies were opened recently. We'll take the startup ecosystem...to...international level," he said. "The Startup Park on Super Corridor is going to be constructed very soon," he added.

29.title: We've got to have a style of cricket that people want to watch: Stuart Broad
29.article_body: Ahead of England's three-Test series against New Zealand, Stuart Broad has said, "We've got to have a style of cricket that people want to watch." He added, "I'm going in with the mindset to attack...leave my heart and soul on the field." Notably, almost 20,000 tickets have reportedly gone unsold for the first four days of the first England-NZ Test.

30.title: Gujarat Congress MLA detained for holding rally without police nod
30.article_body: Congress MLA from Gujarat's Vansda, Anant Patel, was detained for holding a rally in Navsari without police permission on Tuesday. Patel addressed the contractual workers of Gujarat Energy Transmission Corporation (GETCO), who have been demanding their salaries to be increased. The MLA has warned of staging a protest seeking the suspension of Local Crime Branch (LCB) Police Inspector.

31.title: It was special, priceless: Shimla girl on PM accepting portrait from her
31.article_body: Anu Yadav, the 26-year-old artist who presented the portrait of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's mother to him during his roadshow in Shimla, said it was a special and priceless moment for her. "He appreciated my effort. Such a gesture from Prime Minister gives me motivation," Yadav said. PM Modi had asked her how many days she took to complete painting.

32.title: Farmer leader Dilbag Singh, witness in Lakhimpur Kheri case, shot at in UP
32.article_body: Bhartiya Kisan Union (BKU) leader Dilbag Singh, who is a witness in the Uttar Pradesh's Lakhimpur Kheri case, was allegedly attacked by two unidentified men on Tuesday, police said. FIR has been registered against two unknown persons. The shooters punctured a tyre of his SUV and later fired shots at the window pane of the driver's side, Singh claimed.

33.title: Vivek Agnihotri threatens to sue Oxford Union, says 'President-elect is a Pakistani'
33.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri has threatened to file a lawsuit against Oxford Union, the student-run debating society at Oxford University, after it rescheduled his event from Tuesday to July 1 citing "double booking". "They have cancelled me. In reality, they cancelled Hindu genocide and Hindu students who are a minority at Oxford University. The president-elect is a Pakistani," Agnihotri tweeted.

34.title: Raj Thackeray's hip surgery postponed after he tests COVID-19 +ve
34.article_body: MNS chief Raj Thackeray's hip surgery, which was scheduled to take place on Wednesday, has been postponed after he tested positive for COVID-19. Thackeray, who is suffering from avascular necrosis, was admitted to Mumbai's Lilavati Hospital for undergoing hip replacement surgery. The surgery has been put on hold until his COVID-19 test returns negative.

35.title: 9 injured as bus crashes into 3 vehicles in Delhi's Shastri Park
35.article_body: As many as nine people were injured on Tuesday after a bus allegedly jumped a divider and crashed into three vehicles in Delhi's Shastri Park, police said. "An investigation has been taken up to nab the accused driver who fled the spot," an official added. The injured were shifted to a hospital and their condition is stable, the official stated.

36.title: SRK's shoot with Salman Khan in Tiger 3 delayed due to a wig: Report
36.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan's shoot with Salman Khan in 'Tiger 3' has reportedly been delayed due to a wig that has been designed and made for SRK's look in 'Dunki'. "SRK is presently shooting for 'Dunki' with an all-new look...will then shoot for Atlee's film...only after that will he join Salman for his...appearance in 'Tiger 3'," a source told ETimes.

37.title: My heart is shattered in pieces: Shreya Ghoshal on singer KK's demise
37.article_body: Condoling the demise of singer KK, Shreya Ghoshal tweeted, "Numb...Heart is shattered in pieces." "One of the most...gentle, pure human [beings] I have met...God's dear child was sent to spread love in the lives of millions of fans," added Shreya. "Now God needed him back? So soon?! Cruel!" stated Shreya. Singer Vishal Dadlani said his heart is in "tatters".

38.title: TN transformed into Eden of Peace: CM Stalin on opposition's law & order remark
38.article_body: Rejecting the charge of opposition parties that law and order in Tamil Nadu have deteriorated, Chief Minister MK Stalin said that the situation in the state is stable and peaceful. "There are no caste or communal clashes," Stalin claimed. "Due to effective administration...crimes have been kept under check and the state has transformed into an Eden of Peace," he said.

39.title: Mumbai Traffic Police to observe No Honking Day every Wednesday
39.article_body: The Mumbai Traffic Police has decided to observe a No Honking Day in the city every Wednesday. During the drive, officials will be posted at more than 100 junctions in the city to penalise motorists caught honking without any reason. The initiative is aimed at curbing noise pollution, traffic police said, adding that violators will also be sent for counselling.

40.title: KK asked to dim spotlights on him, complained about crowd around stage: Report
40.article_body: Singer KK was sweating excessively due to the heat on stage at Kolkata's Nazrul Mancha and had asked the organisers to dim the spotlights on him, The Indian Express reported. He reportedly also complained to the organisers about crowding around the stage. KK died shortly after performing a live gig at Nazrul Mancha auditorium on Tuesday night.

41.title: I absolutely love wacky, dark humoured entertainment: Shahid Kapoor
41.article_body: Talking about American series 'The Boys', actor Shahid Kapoor said, "I absolutely love wacky, dark humoured and action-packed entertainment. When I first heard about 'The Boys', I was immediately intrigued." "I can't wait to binge all three seasons," added Shahid. Shahid was last seen in the film 'Jersey' which is a remake of the 2019 Telugu film 'Jersey'.

42.title: TRS govt didn't build houses for poor as promised in T'gana: Kishan Reddy
42.article_body: Union Tourism Minister G Kishan Reddy on Tuesday alleged that the TRS government in Telangana did not build houses for the poor as promised. "In Telangana, the government said 'we will build double bedroom houses only and not any 'dabba' houses.' Eight years have passed. Houses have not been built for the poor so far," Reddy said.

43.title: Man kills co-worker after fight over vegetable-cutting knife in B'luru
43.article_body: A 25-year-old cook at a hotel in Bengaluru's Rajarajeshwari Nagar was allegedly stabbed to death by his co-worker following a fight on Monday. The fight reportedly broke out after the accused, Aryan Pushkar, took a knife used by the deceased, Milan Baral, to cut vegetables in the kitchen. Police have arrested the 20-year-old accused. Both the cooks hailed from Nepal.

44.title: UP CM lays foundation stone for Ram Mandir's Garbhagriha in Ayodhya
44.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Wednesday laid the foundation stone for Ram Mandir's Garbhagriha in Ayodhya. "Ram Mandir will be the national temple of India. People have been waiting for this day since a long time. Ram Mandir will be a symbol of India's unity," the Chief Minister said, adding that the temple construction work is successfully proceeding.

45.title: TikTok-parent may partner with Hiranandani in India: Report
45.article_body: TikTok-parent ByteDance is looking to reenter India and is planning to partner with Mumbai-based realty conglomerate Hiranandani Group and rehire former employees, Economic Times reported. ByteDance had shut down operations in India in 2021. "There have been no formal talks with us yet. But we have been informed of the plans," a senior government official told ET.

46.title: Video of singer KK being rushed out of concert venue moments before he died surfaces
46.article_body: A video of singer KK being rushed out of the concert venue in Kolkata moments before he passed away has surfaced online. In the video, visibly uncomfortable KK can be seen being escorted out of the venue by some men. Before being rushed out of the venue, he was heard saying, 'God bless you all!' to the fans.

47.title: 'Will give result in 2 days', Neeraj Bawana gang threatens on FB over Moosewala murder
47.article_body: Neeraj Bawana gang has condemned the killing of Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala and issued an open threat that it will give result within two days in a Facebook post on Monday. The post was uploaded from a Facebook profile named Neeraj Bawana Delhi NCR, in which names of Tillu Tajpuriya gang, Koushal Gurgaon gang, and Davinder Bambiha gang were mentioned.

48.title: IPL 2022 was quite special for me, had some really good moments: Shubman
48.article_body: GT opener Shubman Gill, who was the second-highest run-scorer for his franchise in IPL 2022, has said that the season was "quite special" and he had "some really good moments". He added, "Nobody considered GT a threat...it did not make sense to me...The important thing was, once we got the momentum we never really let it slip away from us."

49.title: Delhi govt to give free power connections to shops of Kashmiri Pandits
49.article_body: Delhi government will provide free electricity connections to over 100 shops run by Kashmiri Pandits in INA market, Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said. In a meeting on Tuesday, Sisodia directed officials to inspect places for installation of transformers in the market area. This comes after a delegation of Kashmiri Pandits apprised CM Arvind Kejriwal about electricity issues in the market.

50.title: US supports Russian grain exports amid global hunger concerns
50.article_body: Amid concerns of rising global hunger, the US ambassador to the UN, Linda Thomas-Greenfield, said that President Joe Biden's government supports the export of Russian grain and fertilisers. She said that there are no US sanctions on such shipments and that the country is ready to give "comfort letters" to exporters who are "a little nervous" and holding back.

51.title: UP govt cancels licences of liquor shops in Ayodhya's Ram Mandir area
51.article_body: The licences of all liquor shops in Ayodhya's Ram Mandir area have been cancelled, Uttar Pradesh Minister of State for Excise (Independent Charge) Nitin Agarwal said. This comes after a BSP member sought information about the status of amendments made to the Excise Shops Rules, 1968. CM Yogi Adityanath on Wednesday will lay the foundation stone of Ram Mandir's 'garbhagriha'.

52.title: Facebook-parent Meta to trade under 'META' ticker from June 9
52.article_body: Facebook-parent company has announced that it will change its stock ticker symbol to 'META' this month. The firm will begin trading on the Nasdaq under the ticker symbol prior to market opening on June 9, replacing its current ticker symbol 'FB'. The current ticker 'FB' has been in use since the company's IPO in 2012.

53.title: Forced to quit studies, were being harassed: Cousin of Raj suicide victims
53.article_body: Hemraj Meena, cousin of the three sisters who were found dead in a well in Rajasthan, said that the deceased were being harassed by their in-laws over dowry and had been forced to quit their studies. "The three sisters used to do everything together since childhood. They even married into the same household," Hemraj added.

54.title: I can't do as much work as PM Modi does in 1 day: Akshay Kumar
54.article_body: Talking about what he would do if he became India's Prime Minister for one day, Akshay Kumar said, "Our PM does so much work, I don't think I can do so much work in one day." "I can work for myself...but cannot manage the whole nation. I get a chance to do a lot of things through films," added Akshay.

55.title: US will send long range advanced rocket systems to Ukraine: Biden
55.article_body: The US will provide Ukraine with more advanced rocket systems and munitions so it can "more precisely strike key targets on the battlefield", US President Joe Biden said. "These systems will be used by the Ukrainians to repel Russian advances on Ukrainian territory, but they will not be used on targets in Russian territory," a US official told reporters.

56.title: BMC releases list of 269 unauthorised schools operating in Mumbai
56.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) released a list of 269 unauthorised schools operating in Mumbai and asked parents to be cautious before admitting children. The highest number of unauthorised schools were found in Govandi, having 49 such schools. Some other places where unauthorised schools were found are Mankhurd, Kurla, Chembur, Wadala, Antop Hill, Dharavi, Santacruz and Jogeshwari.

57.title: Canada decriminalises cocaine, meth, other drugs in 1 province
57.article_body: Canada has decided to temporarily decriminalise possession of drugs such as cocaine, methamphetamine and MDMA (ecstasy) in small amounts in British Columbia. It will be a three-year experiment aimed at preventing overdose deaths by easing the fear of arrest among people who need help. Stigma and fear of criminalisation cause some people to hide their drug use, an official noted.

58.title: A great singer, family man: TMC's Babul Supriyo on KK's demise
58.article_body: Condoling the demise of singer KK, TMC leader Babul Supriyo, a singer-turned politician, said that KK lived a simple and calm life. "KK was a great singer and a family man…I never saw him attending many parties. I have a lot of memories with him," Supriyo added. "One of the nicest guys the music industry ever had," Supriyo tweeted.

59.title: KK performed one song after another, unbelievable he's no more: Student at last concert
59.article_body: Shibasis Banerjee, a student at Kolkata's Gurudas College who attended KK's last concert, said, "He performed one song after another on the stage. It is unbelievable that he is no more." "I met him at such a show during the initial days of my college, when I told him that today, he instantly recognised me," Banerjee added.

60.title: Video of KK sweating at concert surfaces, fan says 'He complained about AC not working'
60.article_body: A video of singer KK sweating excessively during his performance at a concert in Kolkata hours before his death surfaced online. In the video, KK can be seen wiping his face with a towel and seemingly complaining about the AC. "AC wasn't working at Nazrul Mancha. He performed there and complained about it," a fan wrote while sharing the video.

61.title: Black year for Indian music; Lata, Bappi, Sidhu, now KK: Armaan Malik
61.article_body: Taking to Twitter, singer Armaan Malik mourned the demise of singer KK, who passed away on Tuesday at the age of 53. "Black year for Indian music. Lata [Mangeshkar] didi, Bappi [Lahiri] da, Sidhu [Moosewala] paaji and now KK sir. These losses...all of them feel so personal," he tweeted. "Extremely sad and devastated...Can't believe our KK...is no more," he wrote.

62.title: 19-yr-old fan of Sidhu Moosewala attempts to kill self at Mohali village
62.article_body: Upset with the death of Sidhu Moosewala, a 19-year-old fan of the Punjabi singer allegedly tried to end his life at his house in Mohali's Jandpur village, police said. According to the boy's father, his son had stopped talking and kept denying food since the death of the singer on Sunday. On Tuesday, he reportedly consumed a floor cleaning liquid.

63.title: He will live on through his music: Laxman on singer KK's demise
63.article_body: Condoling the demise of singer KK, former India cricketer VVS Laxman tweeted, "Saddened by the untimely demise of a wonderful singer, KK. He will live on through his music." Laxman added, "My heartfelt condolences to his family and friends." KK passed away after performing at a live concert in Kolkata on Tuesday.

64.title: Violating hijab order can lead to anti-national activities: Union Min
64.article_body: Union Minister of State for Agriculture and Farmers' Welfare Shobha Karandlaje said that violating the Karnataka High Court order which restricts the use of hijab in educational institutions can lead to anti-social and anti-national activities. Those violating it should be dealt with strictly, she added. This comes after 12 women in Mangalore University were denied entry, citing the HC order.

65.title: Mumbai man who killed 7-yr-old daughter as part of 'suicide pact' traced
65.article_body: Mumbai Police have traced a 39-year-old man who allegedly killed his seven-year-old daughter last week as part of a suicide pact, reports said. The man could not kill himself even though his wife consumed poison. Police said the couple decided to kill themselves and their daughter because of financial struggles. The man and his wife are likely to be arrested.

66.title: Case of unnatural death filed after KK's demise, post-mortem to be conducted today
66.article_body: A case of unnatural death has been filed after singer KK's demise in Kolkata. A post-mortem will be conducted today to ascertain the cause of the singer's death. KK passed away on Tuesday after falling ill following his concert in Kolkata's Nazrul Mancha. The case has been registered at the New Market Police Station.

67.title: Aamir Khan is rocking it like he always does: Rajamouli on 'Laal...'
67.article_body: Filmmaker SS Rajamouli, taking to Twitter, praised the trailer of Aamir Khan-starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. "Loved the trailer of 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. He is rocking it like he always does. Can't wait to watch this one in theatres," Rajamouli tweeted. The film also features Kareena Kapoor and Naga Chaitanya. 'Laal Singh Chaddha' is a remake of Tom Hanks' 'Forrest Gump'.

68.title: Pune woman offered drug-laced biscuits, robbed of gold chain
68.article_body: A 52-year-old Pune woman was robbed of her gold chain worth ₹1.50 lakh after eating biscuits laced with sedatives offered by her co-passenger while returning to the city from Ahmednagar by bus. The woman reportedly fell unconscious after eating the biscuits and had to be hospitalised after the bus reached the final destination. Police have launched a manhunt for accused.

69.title: India reports 2,745 new COVID-19 cases, active cases rise to 18,386
69.article_body: India has reported 2,745 COVID-19 cases, 2,236 recoveries and 6 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,338 COVID-19 cases and 19 deaths. Active cases in India increased to 18,386, while the death toll reached 5,24,636.

70.title: Biden seeks New Zealand PM Jacinda Ardern's advice on tackling gun violence in US
70.article_body: US President Joe Biden has sought advice from New Zealand PM Jacinda Ardern over tackling gun violence. "We need your guidance," Biden said during the meeting in the Oval Office. "Your leadership has taken on a critical role in this global stage and it really has galvanising action...to curb violence, extremism, and online, like happened in Christchurch," he added.

71.title: It's a chain, T'gana shop owner saves 20% to help: Sonu on being inspiration
71.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood said that helping people and becoming an inspiration for many is a great feeling and that it is becoming a chain. "In Telangana, there is a meat shop. The owner saves 20% from his funds and helps people. We inspire each other...It's mutual," Sonu said, adding that his milkman also tries to help everyone in the society.

72.title: Sania Mirza knocked out of French Open after defeat in women's doubles
72.article_body: India's Sania Mirza was knocked out of the ongoing French Open after she suffered defeat in the third round of the women's doubles. Sania and her Czech partner Lucie Hradecka lost to the American pair of Coco Gauff and Jessica Pegula with a scoreline of 4-6 3-6. Earlier, Sania had lost her mixed doubles match.

73.title: PM Modi’s Shimla visit a failed attempt to allay fear of defeat: Congress
73.article_body: Himachal Pradesh Congress chief Pratibha Singh called PM Modi's Shimla visit a failed attempt to allay fear of defeat. She said the state government spent crores on his rally but he left people disappointed as he didn't announce anything for them. Instead of interacting with beneficiaries of government schemes, PM Modi should've talked to people affected by unemployment, she added.

74.title: Andhra techie kills wife, police find body after 5 months in lake
74.article_body: A techie in Andhra Pradesh, identified as Venugopal, allegedly killed his wife and dumped her body in a lake near Tirupati five months ago, police said. Police took Venugopal to the lake where he showed them her dead body, an official said. He had allegedly killed her, then wrapped her body in blankets and dumped it in the lake.

75.title: AAP’s Sanjay Singh demands Eshwarappa’s arrest for 'insulting national flag'
75.article_body: AAP leader Sanjay Singh has demanded that BJP leader and ex-Karnataka minister KS Eshwarappa should be arrested for "insulting the national flag". This comes after Eshwarappa said RSS flag "will become the national flag someday". "For more than 50 years, the national flag was not hoisted at RSS headquarters. Actually, the BJP is opposed to the national flag," Singh said.

76.title: Delhi HC allows woman to donate kidney to father without husband's consent
76.article_body: The Delhi High Court has allowed a woman to donate her kidney to her ailing father without husband's consent. The woman had approached the court after a hospital insisted that she obtain a no-objection certificate from her husband. The right to be in control of her own body is "personal and inalienable", said the court.

77.title: Reshot Brahmastra for 4 days after suggestions from SS Rajamouli’s dad: Ranbir
77.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor said that 'Brahmastra' director Ayan Mukerji made them reshoot the film for four days after he got suggestions from filmmaker SS Rajamouli's father. "This is because he values him so much and we all are very grateful for his contribution to our film," Ranbir added. Ayan said that he thought the film would never get made.

78.title: Felt depressed about roles going to younger actors: Radhika Apte
78.article_body: Actress Radhika Apte said she felt "depressed" about younger actors coming in and taking over. "I was a bit depressed because I...realised that a lot of work that I wanted to do, was going away to people who had done a lot of jobs (points to face)...They looked a certain way. The image of sexy was just that," added Radhika.

79.title: Kashmir essential part of PM Modi's New India journey: Union Minister
79.article_body: Kashmir is an essential part of PM Narendra Modi's New India journey, said Union Minister of State Jitendra Singh on Tuesday at a public gathering in Budgam. Singh attended the "Garib Kalyan Sammelan" that was virtually addressed by PM Modi from Shimla. Singh distributed certificates related to Mudra Yojana, Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana and other welfare schemes on the occasion.

80.title: Your magical voice will live on forever: Vicky Kaushal on KK's demise
80.article_body: Actor Vicky Kaushal took to Instagram Stories and paid tribute to singer KK, who passed away on Tuesday. "Your magical voice will live on forever. Thank you for your evergreen songs," Vicky wrote. Actor Ranveer Singh also shared KK's picture on Instagram Stories with a broken heart emoji. The singer was 53 years old.

81.title: Hyderabad Police books BJP's Nupur Sharma over remarks on Prophet
81.article_body: Hyderabad Police booked BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma for her alleged objectionable remarks against Prophet Muhammad during a TV debate. This is the third case against Sharma. Earlier, an FIR was lodged in Mumbai followed by a second case against her in Thane. An FIR has also been registered against former BJP leader Qavi Abbasi of AIMIM (Inquilab) for threatening Sharma.

82.title: Bengaluru likely to witness rainfall for next 2-3 days: IMD
82.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted that Bengaluru might receive up to 7 mm of rainfall in the coming two or three days. The maximum and minimum temperatures in the city are likely to be around 31 and 21 degrees Celsius, respectively. The city on Tuesday received 6.9 mm rainfall. Since March 1, Bengaluru has received 421 mm rain.

83.title: 2nd line of lawyers missing, a senior lawyer should guide at least 15 juniors: SC
83.article_body: The Supreme Court observed that the second line of lawyers seems to be “substantially missing" in the court. Every senior lawyer should guide at least 15 junior lawyers, the bench said. "We want young generation of this profession to be groomed so that by the time the older generation wants to quit, the young generation is ready," the bench added.

84.title: 41-yr-old woman delivers in Mumbai hotel toilet, abandons baby in dustbin
84.article_body: A 41-year-old woman has been booked for abandoning her child in a bathroom dustbin after giving birth in a five-star hotel in Mumbai on Monday. The woman had come to the hotel for some work but delivered the child in toilet due to sudden labour, police said. The woman alleged she abandoned the newborn over personal dispute with her husband.

85.title: Price of 19-kg commercial LPG cylinder cut by ₹135; new price list for cities released
85.article_body: The price of a 19-kg commercial LPG cylinder has been reduced by ₹135, according to news agency ANI. A commercial cylinder will now cost ₹2,219 in Delhi, ₹2,171.50 in Mumbai, ₹2,322 in Kolkata and ₹2,373 in Chennai, ANI reported. New rates are effective from today.

86.title: TV actor Karan Grover marries longtime girlfriend Poppy Jabbal, shares pic
86.article_body: TV actor Karan Grover tied the knot with Poppy Jabbal after dating for almost a decade. Sharing a picture on Instagram, Karan wrote, "MayDay!! MayDay!! We finally did it." The duo reportedly got married in Himachal Pradesh in the presence of close family and friends. Poppy Jabbal is best known for her role in 'Broken But Beautiful'.

87.title: South African cricketer Mondli Khumalo in serious condition after assault outside UK pub
87.article_body: South African cricketer Mondli Khumalo is in serious condition after being assaulted outside a pub in UK's Bridgwater on Saturday night. Khumalo, 20, suffered bleeding in the brain and underwent at least two operations. A 27-year-old man has been arrested in connection with the assault. Khumalo was celebrating a victory with his club team when the incident happened.

88.title: I love my darling Prabhas, he's a very dear friend of mine: Ranbir
88.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor, when asked to name his favourite Telugu actor, said, "I...love my darling Prabhas. He is a very dear friend of mine." He also added that he finds all the other Telugu actors great. Ranbir began promotions of his film 'Brahmastra' in Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh, along with the film's director Ayan Mukerji and filmmaker SS Rajamouli.

89.title: Delhi's air quality with AQI of 212 in May worst for the month in 3 yrs
89.article_body: Delhi's air quality in May 2022 was the poorest for the month in three years, as per Central Pollution Control Board. The national capital's average air quality index (AQI) in May 2022 stood at 212, as against 144 in 2021 and 143 in 2020. Delhi received only 1.4 mm of rainfall from May 1 to May 20, according to IMD.

90.title: I have lost my voice: R Madhavan on singer KK's demise
90.article_body: Condoling the demise of singer KK, actor R Madhavan tweeted, "Heartbroken...lost a wonderful human and a great voice today. Rest In Peace bro. The heavens are luckier." In another tweet, Madhavan wrote, "I lost my voice today." KK passed away after performing at a live concert in Kolkata on Tuesday.

91.title: 13-time champion Nadal beats world no. 1 Djokovic to reach French Open semi-final
91.article_body: Thirteen-time Roland Garros champion Rafael Nadal defeated the current world number one Novak Djokovic to reach French Open 2022 semi-final. Nadal won the match with a scoreline of 6-2, 4-6, 6-2, 7-6(7-4) in four hours and 12 minutes. In the semi-final, Nadal will face Alexander Zverev, who defeated Carlos Alcaraz in the quarter-final.

92.title: Thought I'll die making Brahmastra, people asked why it's so expensive: Ayan
92.article_body: 'Brahmastra' director Ayan Mukerji said he thought that the film would never get made and that he would die making it. "So many people asked me why the film is taking so long...why is it so expensive...They asked me to make another romantic film...I always believed...if we got 'Brahmastra' right, it would be very pioneering for our country," he added.

93.title: Video shows KK singing 'Hum rahe ya na rahe kal' at live concert moments before he died
93.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing KK singing 'Hum rahe ya na rahe kal' at a live concert in Kolkata before he passed away. KK fell unwell after performing at the concert. He later returned to his hotel and collapsed. He was rushed to Calcutta Medical Research Institute (CMRI) at around 10.30 pm on Tuesday, where doctors declared him dead.

94.title: We will always remember him through his songs: PM Modi after singer KK's demise
94.article_body: Condoling the demise of singer KK, PM Narendra Modi tweeted, "Saddened by the untimely demise of noted singer Krishnakumar Kunnath popularly known as KK." "His songs reflected a wide range of emotions...We will always remember him through his songs," he added. The singer died aged 53 after a live performance in Kolkata.

95.title: Singer KK passes away aged 53 after his live performance in Kolkata
95.article_body: Singer KK, who was in Kolkata for a concert, passed away on Tuesday evening at the age of 53. The playback singer reportedly collapsed after the concert and was rushed to a private hospital in the city, where he was pronounced dead. He was performing at a concert at Nazrul Mancha.

96.title: Bhubaneswar man arrested for killing newly-wed wife over dowry
96.article_body:
Police said that a man was arrested for allegedly killing his newly-wed wife for dowry in Odisha's 
Bhubaneswar. The 27-year-old victim was found dead at her residence on May 29, after which her parents filed a complaint claiming that she was murdered by her in-laws. In the complaint, the victim's family claimed she was "subjected to physical and mental torture".

97.title: Farmers' incomes have risen: Piyush Goyal at Garib Kalyan Sammelan
97.article_body: Speaking at 'Garib Kalyan Sammelan' in Shimla, Union Minister Piyush Goyal lauded the Centre's commitment to the betterment of lives of farmers and the poor. "Farmers' incomes have increased and the poor people have received financial support directly into their accounts, which eliminated corruption in welfare interventions," Goyal said. Indian farm exports will continue to grow, he added.

98.title: India spends over ₹5,900 cr every year to clean up littered tobacco products: WHO
98.article_body: The cleaning up of littered tobacco products costs India $766 million (over ₹5,900 crore) every year, the World Health Organization (WHO) has said. WHO estimated the cost of total litter from all product waste in India is about $8 billion. It said around 9.57% of this goes towards cleaning tobacco products' litter.

99.title: It was an unexpected season: Skipper Rohit on last-placed MI in IPL 2022
99.article_body: Reflecting on MI's IPL 2022 performance, in which they finished last on the points table, captain Rohit Sharma said it was an "unexpected" season. "Now it's about how we look at the next season and how we prepare...we are gonna come back stronger," he added. MI had their worst-ever season in IPL history, losing 10 out of 14 matches.

100.title: Millions face severe hunger in Horn of Africa amid drought: UN
100.article_body: The United Nations and humanitarian agencies on Tuesday warned that millions of people face severe hunger in the Horn of Africa amid the worst drought in over 40 years. An estimated 16.7 million people currently face acute food insecurity in East Africa, a joint statement said. That number could increase to 20 million by September, it added.

101.title: Ranbir is the most humble superstar, enjoyed every moment with him: Nagarjuna
101.article_body: Speaking about working with Ranbir Kapoor in Brahmastra, actor Nagarjuna said "Even though Ranbir is a superstar, he's the most humble person I've met." "When it comes to his films, be it 'Yeh Jawaani Hai Deewani', 'Wake Up Sid' or 'Sanju', it's unbelievable that the same person...played all these characters. I enjoyed every minute...I spent with him," Nagarjuna added.

102.title: 32 journalists killed in Ukraine since start of war: Prez Zelenskyy
102.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said that a total of 32 media workers have been killed in Ukraine since the beginning of the war on February 24. His comment comes after the death of French journalist Frédéric Leclerc-Imhoff on Monday. Leclerc-Imhoff was hit by shrapnel while covering a Ukrainian evacuation operation in the Luhansk region, according to reports.

103.title: KKR's Umesh was swinging the ball at 145 kmph like old days: Harbhajan
103.article_body: Praising Umesh Yadav following his performance in recently concluded IPL 2022, Harbhajan Singh said the 34-year-old made a "splendid comeback". He added, "This was the Umesh we knew of. He was swinging the ball at 145 kmph just like the old days." The KKR pacer took 16 wickets this season. KKR finished seventh in the standings.

104.title: He's a great match winner, scared of nobody: Mouratoglou on 19-year-old Rune
104.article_body: Calling Holger Rune "a great match winner", Serena Williams' coach Patrick Mouratoglou said the 19-year-old has a complete game and isn't scared of anyone. "He believes he can beat anyone, same as Carlos Alcaraz. And he is doing it, because he's beating top players," he added. Unseeded Rune entered his first Grand Slam quarter-final at 2022 French Open on Monday.

105.title: 'I never gave drugs to anyone, unaware why Aryan is lying,' Ananya reportedly told NCB
105.article_body: According to India Today, Ananya Panday, in her reply to NCB, refuted Aryan Khan's alleged statement that she gave him weed "to dispose of" after taking it from her younger sister, stated the chargesheet. "I'm unaware as to why he's lying about this," she reportedly told NCB. "I want to state...I've never given any drug/contraband to anyone," Ananya reportedly stated.

106.title: DA for Uttarakhand govt employees hiked by 3% to 31% from July 1
106.article_body: The Uttarakhand government on Tuesday announced that the Dearness Allowance (DA) for state government employees will be increased to 31% from July 1. State government employees who are admissible in the seventh pay commission will benefit from this decision. The 3% hike in Dearness Allowance will benefit approximately 2.5 lakh employees and pensioners.

107.title: 18 lakh homes to be built in K'taka under PMAY in 3 yrs: CM Bommai
107.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai announced that over 18 lakh homes will be constructed in the state under the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (PMAY) in the next three years. "PMAY aims at ensuring a roof over the head for each family in the country," he said. Bommai also lauded PM Narendra Modi's several initiatives for the welfare of the marginalised sections.

108.title: Indiabulls' e-commerce firm Yaari fires 60% of its workforce: Report
108.article_body: Indiabulls' e-commerce platform Yaari has laid off around 150 employees, about 60% of its entire workforce, over the last 30 days, Moneycontrol reported. Yaari is planning to shut down business operations and merge with Dhani, another Indiabulls entity, Moneycontrol quoted a former Yaari employee as saying. As per reports, Yaari did not give any notice period to the fired employees.

109.title: First cargo ship leaves Ukraine's Mariupol since Russian takeover
109.article_body: Denis Pushilin, the Russian-backed separatist leader of the Ukrainian breakaway region of Donetsk, on Tuesday said that a cargo ship has left the port of Mariupol for the first time since Russia took the city. The ship is carrying 2,500 tonnes of metal to Russia, he added. Ukraine had said that the shipment of metal amounted to looting.

110.title: People in power in Odisha jealous of PM Modi: Dharmendra Pradhan
110.article_body: Speaking in Odisha's Podamarai, Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan said that people in power in Odisha are "increasingly jealous of PM Narendra Modi". He added, on the contrary, Odisha's support for the PM is growing. "There is no dearth of funds for the infrastructure and development of the people of Odisha, but is misused...by the government here," he said.

111.title: Miscreants vandalise idols of Hindu deities in Karnataka's Hassan
111.article_body: A group of unidentified persons have vandalised idols of Hindu deities in Karnataka's Hassan district. The idols, some of which were ready for installation and some were under construction, were reportedly kept at an exhibition centre near the Malekallu Tirupati temple. Police claimed the miscreants also smoked in the temple area despite objections and chased away the labourers working there.

112.title: BJP uses CBI, ED for its political vendetta against people: Mamata
112.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday accused the BJP of using CBI and Enforcement Directorate (ED) against people for its political vendetta. Addressing the party workers at Purulia, she said, "[The] central agencies should first arrest the corrupt BJP leaders." "Try whatever you want to, in 2024 (Lok Sabha elections), there will be no entry for BJP," she added.

113.title: Congress spoiled my winning streak, won't work with them: Kishor
113.article_body: Political strategist Prashant Kishor said on Monday that he won't work with Congress as the party spoiled his track record. "From 2011-2021, I was associated with 11 elections and lost only one election that's with...Congress in UP," he said. Kishor refused to join Congress in April, citing need for "leadership and collective will to fix structural problems" in party.

114.title: Cauvery water will reach tail-end areas through desilting: TN CM
114.article_body: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin said that the initiative to desilt irrigation canals in the Cauvery Delta region would help the Cauvery water to reach the tail-end areas and help improve paddy cultivation. He tweeted that 683 desilting works for 4,964.11 km had been completed. His tweet came after concluding a two-day inspection trip to the Cauvery delta districts.

115.title: UP MLAs' Local Area Development Fund hiked to ₹5 cr from ₹3 cr: CM
115.article_body: The MLA Local Area Development (MLALAD) Fund in Uttar Pradesh will be hiked to ₹5 crore from ₹3 crore, CM Yogi Adityanath announced on Tuesday. Notably, the announcement was met with thumping of desks by MLAs of both ruling and opposition parties, according to a media report. The amount was previously hiked from ₹2 crore to ₹3 crore in 2020.

116.title: Minor boy beaten up at gunpoint over old enmity in MP's Morena
116.article_body: A minor boy was beaten up by locals at gunpoint over old enmity and panchayat polls in Kasmada village in Madhya Pradesh's Morena, an official said. The boy, identified as Chhotu Singh Tomar, was allegedly assaulted with sticks. The official added that the incident occurred on Monday evening and a video of the incident went viral on social media.

117.title: Delhi teacher, who's blind since birth, secures 48th rank in UPSC Civil Services Exam
117.article_body: Ayushi, who teaches History at a Delhi government school, has secured 48th rank in the UPSC Civil Services Exam 2021, the final results of which were declared on Monday. Blind since birth, the 29-year-old cracked the exam in her fifth attempt. After completing her schooling, she graduated from Delhi University and later pursued a Master's degree in History from IGNOU.

118.title: Ukraine identified over 600 Russian war crime suspects: Prosecutor
118.article_body: Ukraine has identified over 600 Russian war crime suspects and begun prosecuting around 80 of them, Kyiv's top prosecutor said on Tuesday. Prosecutor General of Ukraine Iryna Venediktova said that list of suspects includes "military, politicians and propaganda agents of Russia". Ukraine's working with five countries and International Criminal Court (ICC) to probe war crimes amid Russian invasion.

119.title: Youth Congress holds protest in Delhi demanding justice for Moosewala
119.article_body: Indian Youth Congress on Tuesday held a candlelight march in Delhi to demand justice for Punjabi singer-Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala's death. Indian Youth Congress President Srinivas BV said, "(AAP chief) Arvind Kejriwal got one chance [in Punjab Assembly elections]. Who'll give one chance to Sidhu Moosewala?...Kejriwal and Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann are responsible for Moosewala's death."

120.title: Assam teacher gets life term for sexually abusing minor student
120.article_body: A local court in Assam's Goalpara district awarded life imprisonment to a private school teacher for sexually abusing a minor girl student, reports stated. The court also imposed a fine of ₹50,000 on the teacher. The accused had allegedly sexually abused the minor girl inside the school premises in 2018, after which the family members lodged a complaint.

121.title: Tejasswi to make her B'wood debut with Dream Girl 2 opposite Ayushmann: Reports
121.article_body: Television actress Tejasswi Prakash will reportedly make her Bollywood debut opposite Ayushmann Khurrana in 'Dream Girl 2'. According to reports, Tejasswi was offered the next instalment of Ekta Kapoor's 'Ragini MMS', however, she wasn't keen on doing that, given its contentious genre. Reports added that she's currently in talks for 'Dream Girl 2' and she might bag the project.

122.title: India's textiles exports highest-ever in 2021-22 at $44.4 bn: Govt
122.article_body: The government on Tuesday said that India recorded its highest-ever textiles and apparel exports in the financial year 2021-22 at $44.4 billion. This represents a 41% growth in exports as compared to the previous financial year. The US was the biggest destination for Indian textiles and apparel shipments at 27%, followed by European Union at 18% and Bangladesh at 12%.

123.title: Surat man accused of smuggling ₹204cr diamonds arrested in Delhi
123.article_body: Customs officials at the Delhi airport arrested a diamond merchant from Surat in connection with a case concerning fraudulent export and smuggling of natural diamonds worth ₹204 crore, reports stated. The accused, Meet Kachhadiya, ran a company called Universal Diamonds in Gujarat. In May 2021, Surat Customs officials seized two consignments of Universal Diamonds for wrong disclosure of weight.

124.title: Law for population control will be brought soon: Union Minister
124.article_body: Union Minister Prahlad Singh Patel on Tuesday said a law for population control will be brought soon. While speaking in Chhattisgarh's Raipur, he claimed that the ruling Congress in the state has failed to achieve targets under some Central schemes. He said there is no problem with water sources in the state but the problem is management.

125.title: Sidhu Moosewala's parents dressed him as a groom for his last rites
125.article_body: Singer Sidhu Moosewala, who was shot dead on Sunday, was dressed as a groom by his parents for his last rites that were performed in Punjab on Tuesday. The 28-year-old was dressed as per a ritual followed in Punjab after a young unmarried man dies, reports said. Moosewala was to reportedly get married to his Canadian fiancee in November.

126.title: IAF officer martyred in CDS chopper crash awarded Shaurya Chakra
126.article_body: Group Captain Varun Singh, who was martyred in a helicopter crash that also claimed the life of India's first CDS General Bipin Rawat, was posthumously awarded Shaurya Chakra by President Ram Nath Kovind on Tuesday. Singh averted the loss of a Light Combat Aircraft and safeguarded civilian property and lives in October 2020. Singh's wife and mother received the award.

127.title: Amnesty demands release of dissidents held past jail term in UAE
127.article_body: Amnesty International on Monday urged authorities in UAE to release a group of dissidents who have been detained past their jail terms. It stated that 10 individuals, arrested in 2012 and due to be released in March and April, were held back for "counter-extremism counselling". "UAE's counterterrorism law is...a smokescreen which...authorities use as a tool of repression," Amnesty added.

128.title: Gyanvapi is a masjid & will remain so: Owaisi as survey pics leaked
128.article_body: After videos and pictures of the Gyanvapi mosque survey were leaked, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said the footage which was being broadcasted on TV channels "could be doctored". "Even if it's genuine, Gyanvapi was a masjid...and will remain a masjid," he added. "Even Supreme Court judges have said that such details shouldn't be played in media," the AIMIM chief said.

129.title: Punjabi singer Mankirt requests security cover after Sidhu Moosewala's murder: Report
129.article_body: Punjabi singer Mankirt Aulakh has requested Punjab Police to increase his security cover after the murder of Sidhu Moosewala, according to a report by India Today. As per the report, he had received threats from the Davinder Bambiha gang. He had reportedly received death threats in April, due to which he has asked police to increase his security cover.

130.title: There will be new season but it will take time: Panchayat director on season 3
130.article_body: When asked if makers are planning a new season of 'Panchayat', director Deepak Kumar Mishra said they are planning a season three of the show, however, they aren't in any haste. "Right now, we have the responsibility of two seasons and thus we'll have to focus...on performances and script," he said. "Thus it will take its own time," he added.

131.title: 18-year-old Coco Gauff enters 1st Grand Slam semis at French Open
131.article_body: Coco Gauff, the 18-year-old, has advanced to the first Grand Slam semi-final of her career after beating fellow American and 2018 finalist Sloane Stephens at French Open on Tuesday. The 18th seed won the quarter-final match 7-5, 6-2. Gauff hasn't dropped a set in the tournament so far. She will now face another last-four debutant Martina Trevisan.

132.title: Assam govt delivers 1st instalment of PMAY to 15,000 beneficiaries
132.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Tuesday handed over the first instalment of ₹32,500 each of the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (PMAY) to around 15,000 beneficiaries of Sivasagar and Charaideo districts. "The government wants all sections of...society, regardless of their social strata, to be adequately served so that no one stays out of...reach of the government's welfare measures," Sarma said.

133.title: 500 civilians killed in attacks from January to March in Mali: UN
133.article_body: The UN in a report on Monday said that over 500 civilians died in attacks carried out by armed forces and Islamist groups in Mali from January to March of this year. The killings represented a 324% rise over the previous quarter, according to Reuters. Notably, the rise in the death toll comes amid a political crisis in Mali.

134.title: My kids wrote better code at 12: Musk on Dogecoin creator's script to detect bots
134.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk said his "kids wrote better code when they were 12" than the script written by Dogecoin creator Jackson Palmer, which he claims can detect crypto scam in Twitter mentions and automatically report them. "If [the script is] so great, he (Palmer) should share it with the world and make everyone's experience with Twitter better," Musk tweeted.

135.title: Black box of crashed Tara Air plane recovered in Nepal
135.article_body: The black box of the Tara Air plane that crashed in Nepal's Mustang district on Sunday was recovered by a team of international and national mountain guides on Tuesday. The black box will be transported to Kathmandu. All 22 people, including four Indians, on board the plane were killed in the crash.

136.title: Khan's supporters at Azadi March had automatic rifles: Minister
136.article_body: Pakistan's Defence Minister Khawaja Asif on Monday claimed that protesters in ex-PM Imran Khan's 'Azadi March' were carrying weapons, including automatic rifles. "Imran Khan had asked protesters to bring weapons...however, the government was aware of that," Asif was quoted as saying by local media. Clashes broke out during Khan's rally on May 25, leading to the arrest of several people.

137.title: Go for no. 4: Vettori on Hardik's batting position in India's T20I squad
137.article_body: Picking a batting position for all-rounder Hardik Pandya ahead of India's upcoming T20I series against South Africa, Daniel Vettori said, "If you can fit him in at number four...go for it. That's the perfect position for him." He stated, "As of now, though, it feels like he's going to slot into number five, with Pant potentially dropping down to six."

138.title: Govt issues guidelines to states on managing monkeypox, lists symptoms to watch
138.article_body: The government has issued guidelines to states and UTs to manage monkeypox in view of its spread in non-endemic nations. It listed monkeypox symptoms- swollen lymph nodes, fever, headache, body aches and profound weakness. Anyone showing one or more of these symptoms with an unexplained acute rash and travel history to an affected country is a suspected case, it said.

139.title: Centre releases ₹86,912 cr to states, clears GST compensation dues
139.article_body: The Centre on Tuesday said it has released ₹86,912 crore to state governments, thereby clearing all GST compensation due to them. The Centre paid part of the compensation dues from its own resources as only about ₹25,000 crore was available in the GST compensation fund. Of the total compensation released, ₹47,617 crore was due up to January.

140.title: India fail to reach men's Asia Cup 2022 hockey final due to inferior goal difference
140.article_body: India were held to a 4-4 draw by South Korea in their last Super 4s stage match of men's Asia Cup 2022 hockey. India finished third on the points table in the Super 4s stage and failed to reach the final. Malaysia, South Korea and India finished with five points each, however, India had an inferior goal difference of +1.

141.title: Tillotama reacts to troll wanting to see her 'naked' like Rytasha
141.article_body: Actress Tillotama Shome shared a screenshot of a troll who sent her the message, "I want to see your nangi (naked) body pic like Rytasha Rathore." Tillotama responded, writing, "Why did this message...offend me so much? Is it because as a professional I struggle with intimacy and nudity on screen?...The power of the naked body...relates to protest and political action."

142.title: I hugged you & called you brother: Himanshi mourns Sidhu Moosewala's demise
142.article_body: Punjabi actress Himanshi Khurana took to Instagram to mourn the death of 28-year-old Punjabi singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala who was killed in Punjab's Mansa. She wrote, "I hugged you and called you...brother...The next day you kept dinner for me in Canada...I noticed that you wore mismatched clothes but you had so much innocence, humbleness and simplicity in you."

143.title: World no. 59 Trevisan reaches 1st Grand Slam semi-final at French Open
143.article_body: World number 59 Martina Trevisan reached her first Grand Slam semi-final at French Open after defeating 17th seed Leylah Fernandez of Canada 6-2, 6-7(3-7), 6-3 in the quarter-final on Tuesday. She became the first Italian woman to reach the semi-finals at Roland Garros, since Sara Errani in 2013. Notably, this is her 10th consecutive win and third career top-20 victory.

144.title: India faces low stagflationary risks: CEA Nageswaran
144.article_body: Chief Economic Advisor (CEA) V Anantha Nageswaran on Tuesday said India faces low stagflationary risks as compared with the rest of the world. After data showed GDP growth in January-March quarter (Q4) slowed down to 4.1%, he said there's considerable momentum in economic activity. RBI's confidence to raise rates is a sign that economic recovery is taking hold, he added.

145.title: 3 arrested over shootout at K'taka theatre during KGF 2 screening
145.article_body: Three persons have been arrested from Bihar for allegedly supplying a gun to a man accused of shooting at another man at a cinema hall in Karnataka's Haveri, police said. The victim is currently recovering in a hospital. The incident has taken place following an altercation between the victim and the accused, while they were watching 'KGF: Chapter 2'.

146.title: 1st arrest made in Sidhu Moosewala murder case, accused sent to 5-day police custody
146.article_body: Two days after Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala was shot dead, Punjab Police on Tuesday made the first arrest. Police formally arrested Manpreet Singh who was detained along with five others from Uttarakhand on Monday. Singh was produced before Mansa court today following which he was sent to custody for five days.

147.title: I quit 'Kyunki Saas...' as I wanted to be film actor: Amar Upadhyay
147.article_body: Actor Amar Upadhyay, known for portraying Mihir in 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi', said that he quit the show because he wanted to be a film actor. Amar said that he was the lead in three shows at the time and was also offered many films. "I kind of messed up as I was handling my dates," he added.

148.title: Prabhas is my darling, I've been a huge fan of South Indian cinema: Ranbir
148.article_body: During Brahmastra's event, actor Ranbir Kapoor said he has been a huge fan of South Indian cinema. "If it's Rajinikanth sir, Kamal Haasan sir...Jr NTR and Ram Charan are dear friends." When asked about his favourite actor, Ranbir said, "I love my darling Prabhas. He's a...dear friend of mine. All...are great. But if I had to choose one, I'll say...Prabhas."

149.title: Cong expresses displeasure over J'khand's RS poll nominee pick
149.article_body: Congress has expressed displeasure after coalition partner Jharkhand Mukti Morcha (JMM) picked its senior leader Mahua Maji as the candidate for upcoming Rajya Sabha polls from Jharkhand. Congress is upset over the "unilateral" move, state Congress in-charge Avinash Pande said. Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren, however, stated that the decision was taken after talks with Congress chief Sonia Gandhi.

150.title: If Musk can run 4 firms, why can't they?: WazirX VP on Co-founders' new ventures
150.article_body: WazirX Vice President Rajagopal Menon said the crypto exchange's Co-founders Siddharth Menon and Nischal Shetty are "very much around" but have started other ventures, after reports suggested they've shifted base to Dubai. He further said, "If you have Jack Dorsey who can run three companies, Elon Musk running 4-billion-dollar companies, why can't Indian founders run multiple companies?"

151.title: 8 BJP candidates from UP file nomination for Rajya Sabha elections
151.article_body: Eight BJP candidates from Uttar Pradesh filed their nominations for the Rajya Sabha elections on Tuesday. Those who filed their nominations included BJP's OBC Morcha national president K Laxman and ex-BJP state president Laxmikant Vajpayee. UP CM Yogi Adityanath, who was also present on the occasion, said, "Hearty congratulations...to all the respected candidates...Victory is sure for all of you."

152.title: BJP leadership warns Dilip Ghosh for criticising Bengal party leaders
152.article_body: BJP leader Dilip Ghosh has been criticised by the party's central leadership for speaking against a section of party leaders in West Bengal. "There have been some avoidable instances when some of your statements or outbursts have...caused embarrassment to the central leadership," BJP National General Secretary Arun Singh wrote in a letter, as per BJP National President JP Nadda's instructions.

153.title: Goa Police file chargesheet against Poonam, Sam in obscene video case
153.article_body: Goa Police has filed a chargesheet against actress Poonam Pandey and her ex-husband Sam Bombay in the 2020 obscene video case. The couple was booked for allegedly shooting an obscene video in the state-owned Chapoli Dam and circulating it on social media platforms in November 2020. Poonam and Sam were arrested following the incident and were later released on bail.

154.title: Liverpool forward Salah wins PFA Fans' Player of the Year award
154.article_body: Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah has been named this year's PFA Premier League Fans' Player of the Year. Notably, Salah has retained the award, winning it for the third time in his career. He scored 23 league goals in 2021-22 season to help his side finish second, behind Manchester City. Salah claimed his third Golden Boot, alongside Tottenham Hotspur's Son Heung-min.

155.title: New Zealand PM Ardern to meet US Prez Biden at White House
155.article_body: New Zealand's PM Jacinda Ardern will meet US President Joe Biden at the White House on Tuesday. After her arrival in the US, Ardern said that she expects to discuss ongoing US engagement in the Indo-Pacific region. "We'll be encouraging the US to...strengthen engagement in our region including economic engagement, which is really critical to our region," she added.

156.title: Mahindra & Mahindra plans IPO for unlisted arms in next 2 yrs: CEO
156.article_body: Mahindra and Mahindra (M&M) will look at monetising its listed and unlisted companies by raising ₹2,000 crore over the next two years, said M&M MD and CEO Anish Shah. Unlisted firms will be on their path to an IPO, he added. M&M also raised its capital expenditure by ₹3,300 crore for auto and farm equipment units.

157.title: S Korean stars Park Shin Hye, Choi Tae Joon welcome baby boy
157.article_body: South Korean stars Park Shin Hye and Choi Tae Joon welcomed their first child on Tuesday. As per the statement by her agency, both Park Shin Hye and her son are in good health. The couple got married in January in a private ceremony in Seoul. They announced their marriage plans and pregnancy in November last year.

158.title: Gill is the only one I thought will be hard to bowl to: GT teammate Rashid
158.article_body: On being asked to name the batter he thinks is difficult to bowl to, GT spinner Rashid Khan said it's his teammate Shubman Gill. He added that he's lucky to have Gill on his side. "So proud to be here with him. With someone like him, it gives you lots of energy in the game," he further said.

159.title: Eritrean forces shell town in Ethiopia, 14-yr-old girl killed: UN
159.article_body: A 14-year-old girl was killed and at least 18 others were injured after Eritrean forces shelled a town in Ethiopia's Tigray region over the weekend, according to UN documents and Tigray People's Liberation Front (TPLF). Eritrean forces had fired 23 rounds into Ethiopia. Notably, Eritrea had supported Ethiopia's federal government in its fight against TPLF, which controls most of Tigray.

160.title: Punjab appoints Ishwar Singh as ADGP law & order 2 days after Moosewala's murder
160.article_body: The Punjab government on Tuesday appointed IPS officer and Additional Director General of Police (ADGP) Ishwar Singh as the new Additional Director General of Police (Law and Order). The post was vacant for seven days after Naresh Kumar was shifted by the state government. This comes two days after singer Sidhu Moosewala was shot dead in Mansa in broad daylight.

161.title: Cannes felt like a mela, I thought 'I'll set fire there': Hina Khan
161.article_body: Actress Hina Khan has spoken about her second appearance at the Cannes Film Festival, saying it felt like a "mela". "Wahan jaake aag lagni hai (I will set a fire there) was my thought," she added. The actress called the five minutes on the carpet magical, adding the media doesn't judge where you are from or what you have done.

162.title: Will try to pick brains of Mhambrey, Dravid: Arshdeep ahead of T20Is vs SA
162.article_body: Ahead of India's upcoming T20I series against South Africa, pacer Arshdeep Singh said he will try to pick the brains of India bowling coach Paras Mhambrey and head coach Rahul Dravid. "I will try to figure out what mental state the player should be in," he added. The 23-year-old was selected in India's 18-member squad for the five-match series.

163.title: Enforcement agencies misunderstand royalty fees: Tech industry body
163.article_body: India Cellular and Electronics Association (ICEA) has said India's enforcement agencies have a "lack of understanding" of royalty payments in the technology industry and has urged the Centre to intervene. In a letter to finance, trade and technology ministers, ICEA said enforcement agencies have taken "a stance that royalty is a simple way to take money out of India".

164.title: American supercomputer becomes world's fastest, beats Japan's 'Fugaku'
164.article_body: 'Frontier', a supercomputer built by Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE), has been ranked the world's fastest, according to the TOP500 list. The supercomputer overtook Japan's 'Fugaku', which has topped the TOP500 list for the last two years. Further, 'Frontier' has reached 1.1 exaflops, making it the world's first supercomputer to break the exascale speed barrier, TOP500 said.

165.title: Played rapist in a film, people asked 'Are you enjoying?': Makarand Deshpande
165.article_body: Actor Makarand Deshpande spoke about playing the role of a rapist in a film and said that some people would ask him if he enjoyed doing a rape scene. "People came there to see the shooting and they asked me, 'Are you enjoying it?' I found that filthy," he added. "These are the people who enjoy such gruesomeness," Deshpande said.

166.title: Georgia's breakaway region shelves referendum on joining Russia
166.article_body: The leader of Georgia's breakaway region of South Ossetia on Monday shelved plans on holding  referendum to join Russia, which was slated to be held on July 17. The referendum, which was finalised by region's ex-leader, was cancelled for being 'premature', according to President Alan Gagloev. Russia recognised South Ossetia as independent after former fought war with Georgia in 2008.

167.title: Lawrence Bishnoi, accused in Moosewala murder, given additional security in jail
167.article_body: Gangster Lawrence Bishnoi, who's lodged in Delhi's Tihar Jail, has been given additional security after he has been named as an accused in the murder of singer Sidhu Moosewala. Bishnoi has moved the Delhi High Court fearing a 'fake encounter' by Punjab Police, seeking to stop the transfer of his custody. Bishnoi's gang members have claimed responsibility for killing Moosewala.

168.title: Pune builder Bhosale sent to CBI custody till June 8 in Yes Bank-DHFL case
168.article_body: A special CBI court in Mumbai on Tuesday remanded Pune-based builder and ABIL Group Chairman Avinash Bhosale to CBI custody till June 8 in an alleged corruption case. The case involves Yes Bank founder Rana Kapoor and Dewan Housing Finance Corporation Ltd (DHFL) promoter Kapil Wadhawan. The CBI arrested Bhosale on May 26.

169.title: Kashmiri Pandits protest J&K teacher's killing, warn of mass migration
169.article_body: Kashmiri Pandits staged a protest in Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar after a female school teacher was shot dead by terrorists in Kulgam on Tuesday. They warned of mass relocation if the government failed to provide a solution amid the killings of innocents in Kashmir within 24 hours. The protesters demanded their relocation to a "safer place" until conditions turn normal.

170.title: Under-construction ceiling of B'luru hospital collapses; 4 rescued
170.article_body: The under-construction ceiling of St Martha's Hospital in Bengaluru collapsed on Tuesday, following which four labourers were left trapped under the debris. Three fire engines and a bulldozer rushed to the spot to rescue the injured workers, who were shifted to a hospital for treatment. Patients had been reportedly advised to avoid using that part, as construction work was underway.

171.title: Akshay, Manushi pay tribute to Samrat Prithviraj at Somnath temple; pic surfaces
171.article_body: Akshay Kumar, Manushi Chhillar and filmmaker Dr Chandraprakash Dwivedi paid their respects at the historic Somnath temple today as a sign of salute to Samrat Prithviraj Chauhan's bravery and sacrifice. Chandraprakash Dwivedi said, "We brought Samrat Prithviraj’s flag to the temple and sought blessings at this holy...place...It's an incredible moment for us as a team."

172.title: Maha Congress leader quits post over 'outsider' pick for RS polls
172.article_body: Congress' Ashish Deshmukh on Tuesday resigned as General Secretary of Maharashtra Pradesh Congress Committee amid disappointment over the party's decision to nominate "outsider" Imran Pratapgarhi from Maharashtra in Rajya Sabha polls. "Imposing an outside candidate will not benefit the party...This is injustice towards...Congress workers in Maharashtra," Deshmukh said. Pratapgarhi hails from UP.

173.title: IIM alumnus gives glimpse of 3 Idiots shoot locations at college, share pics
173.article_body: Actors Aamir Khan, R Madhavan and Sharman Joshi's film '3 Idiots' was filmed in IIM Bangalore. Taking to Instagram, an IIM Bangalore alumnus shared the photos of the real-life locations seen in the movie. The pictures compared scenes from the film to the real-life campus of the institute. He captioned it, "IIM Bangalore X 3 idiots series."

174.title: Why was security cut, how did info come out: HC to Punjab govt after Moosewala death
174.article_body: The Punjab and Haryana High Court has asked the Punjab government to explain the basis on which security was reduced for around 400 people including deceased singer Sidhu Moosewala. The state government will also have to explain how the report of security withdrawal became public. This came on Punjab's ex-Deputy CM OP Soni's plea after his security cover was reduced.

175.title: Lesbian couple forcibly separated by families allowed to live together by Kerala HC
