175.article_body: Kerala High Court allowed a lesbian couple, both adults in their early 20s, to live together. They had been forcibly separated by their families with one of them allegedly being forced into conversion therapy. The bench asked them whether they wanted to live together. Both replied in affirmative after which the court passed the order in their favour.

176.title: Rainfall this monsoon expected to be 103% of average: IMD
176.article_body: India Meteorological Department (IMD) Director General Mrutyunjay Mohapatra on Tuesday said average rainfall this monsoon is expected to be 103% of the long period average, which is considered as normal rainfall. He said central India and south peninsula are set to receive above normal rainfall. This is the fourth consecutive year that India is likely to experience a normal monsoon.

177.title: Russia, Gulf Cooperation Council states to hold talks on Wednesday
177.article_body: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov will meet the Foreign Ministers of the Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC) states in Saudi Arabia on Wednesday, two Gulf officials said on Tuesday. Notably, the ministers from Saudi Arabia, the UAE, Oman, Kuwait, Qatar and Bahrain will hold online talks with the Ukrainian Foreign Minister after their meeting with Lavrov, the officials added.

178.title: Inflation in EU countries hits 8.1% in May, highest since 1997
178.article_body: Inflation in 19 European Union countries hit an all-time high of 8.1% in May, authorities said. Inflation, which is at its highest level since 1997, was driven by a rise in food and energy prices after Russia's invasion of Ukraine sent commodity prices soaring. Core inflation, which excludes volatile components like food, energy and alcohol, rose to 3.8% in May.

179.title: Govt should regulate songs on gangs, gun culture: Daler on Sidhu's death
179.article_body: Singer Daler Mehndi condoled singer Sidhu Moosewala's death, saying that he never heard his songs but heard his name because he was so popular. Daler further urged the government to regulate songs that promote drugs, gangs and gun culture or use bad words for women. "Such songs should be given warning...All this can get controlled if this happens," he added.

180.title: Driver sets taxi stand on fire as its owner scolds him in Delhi; 5 injured
180.article_body: A taxi driver set a taxi stand on fire after its owner allegedly scolded him and misbehaved with him in Delhi, police said. Five people who were sleeping at the taxi stand were injured in the incident, police said, adding that the man has been arrested. A case has been registered in this regard.

181.title: Man finds rubber band in KFC chicken in Hyd; KFC apologises
181.article_body: A Hyderabad-based civic activist, Sai Teja, on Monday took to Twitter and claimed that he found a rubber band in a chicken dish he ordered from KFC through Swiggy. Teja also shared the pictures of the same on Twitter. Reacting to his tweet, KFC India and Swiggy issued an apology and sought details to address his concern.

182.title: Water found unfit for drinking in Gurugram society as 90 fall ill
182.article_body: After over 90 residents of Westend Heights in Gurugram's DLF Phase 5 fell sick, water samples collected from the society were tested unfit for human consumption, an official said. Gurugram's Chief Medical Officer, Virender Yadav, said, "Residents should immediately stop consuming the water for drinking purposes." However, the society's Residents' Welfare Association contradicted the findings.

183.title: Viswanathan Anand beats world number one Magnus Carlsen in chess blitz event
183.article_body: Indian Grandmaster Viswanathan Anand defeated world number one Magnus Carlsen in seventh round of the blitz event of Norway Chess. Anand finished off at the fourth position with five points in the event. American Grandmaster Wesley So won the blitz event with 6.5 points. Earlier this month, 16-year-old Grandmaster R Praggnanandhaa had defeated Carlsen in an online rapid chess tournament.

184.title: Hindustan Unilever CEO Sanjiv Mehta's salary jumps 47% to ₹22 crore in 2021-22
184.article_body: Sanjiv Mehta, the CEO and MD of Hindustan Unilever (HUL), received a salary of ₹22 crore in 2021-22, marking a 47% jump from ₹15 crore in 2020-21. Mehta's total compensation included ₹3.7 crore salary, ₹9.2 crore in allowances, ₹4.3 crore bonus and ₹4.2 crore as perquisite. In 2019-20, Mehta was the highest-paid FMCG CEO, with a salary of ₹19.42 crore.

185.title: OTT has to be different from what I'm chasing in films: Arjun
185.article_body: On being asked about making his debut on OTT platforms, actor Arjun Kapoor said that it has to be very specific because he can't do in theatres what he will do on OTT. "It has to be different from what I'm chasing in films. Sometimes you have to keep waiting to find something exciting," the actor added.

186.title: Dead calf carried by mother elephant for 7 km in WB sent for autopsy
186.article_body: The carcass of a calf that a mother elephant carried for at least seven kilometres in tea gardens of West Bengal's Jalpaiguri district three days ago was recovered by wildlife officials. The cause of the calf's death is yet to be ascertained, the officials said, adding that the carcass has been sent for post-mortem.

187.title: BJP is afraid of Congress party's ideology: P Chidambaram
187.article_body: On being asked whether the BJP-led Union government is afraid of him, senior Congress leader P Chidambaram said the BJP is afraid of his party's ideology and not him. He said, "I'm not a tiger...to be afraid of...I'm an ordinary human being, reflecting the Congress." "I don't think they are afraid of me…they fear the Congress party's ideology," he added.

188.title: India wants job security, not 'racial purity': Rahul Gandhi
188.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday said the country wants job security and economic prosperity, not "racial purity". Reacting to a news report on Culture Ministry's plan to study "racial purity", Gandhi said, "The last time a country had a culture ministry studying 'racial purity', it didn't end well." The Culture Ministry called the news report "mischievous and misleading".

189.title: India's GDP grows 8.7% in 2021-22 compared to 6.6% contraction in 2020-21
189.article_body: India's GDP grew 8.7% in the financial year 2021-22, as compared to a contraction of 6.6% in 2020-21, as per provisional estimates released by the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation on Tuesday. In January-March quarter (Q4), the GDP growth slowed to 4.1%, compared to a 5.4% growth during the October-December quarter (Q3) of 2021-2022.

190.title: My character Shiva in 'Brahmāstra' is a DJ: Ranbir Kapoor
190.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor has revealed at a press event in Vizag that he portrays a DJ in Ayan Mukerji's 'Brahmāstra'. Ranbir further said, "I play the character of Shiva...who is born with a certain strange connection with fire." The actor added that the film is about his journey into the world of ancient astras. The film also stars Alia Bhatt.

191.title: Request farmers to plant more rice: Sri Lanka amid food shortage
191.article_body: Amid Sri Lanka's ongoing economic crisis, the government has urged farmers to plant more rice in their fields. Sri Lanka is likely to experience severe food crisis by August as it needs an estimated $600 million to import fertilisers amid a forex shortage, PM Ranil Wickremesinghe has warned. Additionally, the country is facing a shortage of fuel and medicine supplies.

192.title: No closure report filed against Delhi minister Satyendar Jain: CBI
192.article_body: The CBI on Tuesday refuted reports claiming it had filed a closure report against Delhi minister Satyendar Jain in a disproportionate assets case. AAP MP Sanjay Singh had on Monday claimed Jain was already given a clean chit by CBI in the case. Jain has been sent to Enforcement Directorate's custody till June 9 in an alleged money laundering case.

193.title: It was important to move on: Kanika on recovering from failure of 1st marriage
193.article_body: Singer Kanika Kapoor spoke about how one failed marriage didn't wreck her idea of marriage. Kanika said her parents "lived a happy married life throughout". "Sometimes you can be in a marriage with a partner who doesn't understand you and vice versa," she added. Kanika further said it was important to move on and live a life without any hatred.

194.title: It's the end of another great season of IPL: BCCI President Ganguly
194.article_body: Following the recently concluded IPL 2022, BCCI President Sourav Ganguly took to Twitter and wrote, "It's the end of another great season of IPL...congratulations to all the teams." He added, "Special congratulations to Gujarat Titans for winning the trophy." Hardik Pandya led-GT beat RR by seven wickets to win the IPL title in their debut season.

195.title: Will address issue of uprooting of trees during storms: Delhi LG
195.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor Vinai Kumar Saxena on Tuesday said he will address the issue of uprooting of trees during thunderstorms in Delhi. Taking to Twitter, Saxena said he shares the concern about the maintenance and upkeep of trees and how their uprooting affects Delhi's traffic. "We have taken the matter seriously and will address it at the earliest," he added.

196.title: Unknown man's body with several wounds found under bridge in Thane
196.article_body: Police said that the body of an unidentified man with multiple wounds was found in Maharashtra's Thane. An official from Shil-Daighar Police Station said that on reaching the spot, the police found a paver block near the body and a car nearly 60 metres away. This raised suspicion that the man was killed by miscreants who tried to rob him.

197.title: India's borders more secure than they were before 2014: PM Modi
197.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday said the country's borders have become more secure than they were before 2014. He said, "Before 2014, there was concern about the security of the country, today we're proud of the surgical strike-air strike." PM Modi said this while addressing a rally in Shimla to mark the eighth anniversary of BJP government at the centre.

198.title: 33-yr-old man strangles his girlfriend, kills self in Thane
198.article_body: Police said that a 33-year-old man allegedly strangled his girlfriend to death and later killed himself in Maharashtra's Thane. An official said the incident took place when 33-year-old Anil Salunke visited the victim, 28-year-old Lalita Kale, at her apartment. Salunke was upset that Kale was marrying another man and went to meet her for the last time, the official added.

199.title: Couple, daughters aged 6 & 9 die by suicide near Hyderabad
199.article_body: A couple and their two daughters allegedly died by suicide after jumping into Kurmalguda lake near Hyderabad. The deceased have been identified as Quddus Pasha (37), Fatima (28), Mehar (nine) and Firdous Begum (six). They allegedly consumed a poisonous substance before jumping into the lake.

200.title: Gurugram Police arrests maid for stealing ₹16 lakh from ex-employer
200.article_body: The Gurugram Police on Monday said that a maid was arrested for stealing jewellery worth ₹15 lakh and cash worth ₹1 lakh from the house of her ex-employer in Sector 50. The stolen cash and jewellery were recovered from her possession, the police added. The husband of the accused, a suspect in the case, is absconding, the police further said.

201.title: 'Goldy Brar' who posted pic with Mann clarifies he's not the gangster, says 'Pic misused'
201.article_body: A man named Goldy Brar from Punjab clarified he's not the gangster Goldy Brar, suspected to be behind Sidhu Moosewala's murder. "I'm Goldy Brar, son of Rajinder Singh from...Jandwala. My picture is being misused on social media," he said. The man had posted a congratulatory message for Bhagwant Mann after he became CM and had posted a photo with him.

202.title: PM stops car to accept portrait of his mother from girl in Shimla
202.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday broke his high-security protocol to accept a portrait of his mother made by a girl in Himachal Pradesh's Shimla. The incident took place when PM Modi was taking part in a roadshow. Seeing the girl carrying the sketch of his mother, the PM asked for his car to be stopped to meet her.

203.title: Gandhi family always cheated people of Amethi: Smriti Irani
203.article_body: Union Minister Smriti Irani on Tuesday alleged that the Gandhi family did politics from Uttar Pradesh's Amethi for decades, but kept the constituency's people "poor". "The Gandhi family always cheated people of Amethi," she claimed. Furthermore, she alleged that Congress leader Rahul Gandhi had "left for Kerala in 2019" as he knew Amethi's people had "resentment" against the Gandhi family.

204.title: Demonetisation caused harm, people won't forget: Rahul to PM Modi
204.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday said people will never forget the pain of demonetisation. In a Facebook post, Gandhi said the demonetisation exercise, introduced by PM Narendra Modi's government in 2016, was done "deliberately so that lakhs of crores of loans of 'Modi-friend' capitalists can be waived" off. Many died while waiting in line for money, he added.

205.title: We are secure, rumours don't affect us: Shamita on break-up reports with Raqesh
205.article_body: Actress Shamita Shetty reacted to the rumours of her break-up with her boyfriend Raqesh Bapat. She said, "We (Raqesh and I) have consciously made an effort to not let these things affect us too much." "A relationship is about two people...It can't be about the rest of the world...We both are very secure people...so it doesn’t affect us," she added.

206.title: AAP, Cong create propaganda, defame ED: BJP MP on Satyendar Jain's arrest
206.article_body: BJP MP Jugal Lokhandwala on Monday said Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) and Congress "deliberately create propaganda to defame the Enforcement Directorate (ED)". His comments came after AAP claimed that party leader Satyendar Jain was arrested by ED in a "fake case". "The ED is doing its work...this is your political stunt, it's not going to work," Jugal added.

207.title: US Senator visits Taiwan as China ups military threat
207.article_body: US Senator Tammy Duckworth on Tuesday reiterated America's support for Taiwan on her second visit in a year to the island. Duckworth met Taiwan's President Tsai Ing-wen during the trip. China denounced the visit and said, "Taiwan is a province of China, and there's no so-called President." Thirty Chinese military jets had entered Taiwan's air defence zone on Monday.

208.title: 20,000 tickets unsold at Lord's ahead of Eng-NZ 1st Test: Reports
208.article_body: Almost 20,000 tickets have reportedly gone unsold for the first four days of the Test match between England and New Zealand at the Lord's Cricket Ground, London. As per a Daily Telegraph report, the Barmy Army has cited higher prices as the reason behind sluggish sales. "1,800 tickets available on day one, 2,500 on day two," the report said.

209.title: Federer has always been my idol growing up: 19-year-old Rune
209.article_body: Holger Rune, who became the first Danish man to reach quarter-finals at French Open, said 20-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer has been his idol growing up. "Why I love him so much is basically his game, his transition to...net is very rare," he added. The 19-year-old beat world number four Stefanos Tsitsipas in Roland Garros fourth round on Monday.

210.title: 22-yr-old jailed for creating nuisance in drunken condition in Hyd
210.article_body: Hyderabad City Police on Tuesday took to Twitter to inform that a 22-year-old man has been convicted in a petty case for creating nuisance in drunken condition and misbehaving with ladies in the city. Police further said that a court has sentenced the man, who has been identified as Bandi Akash, to 112 days of imprisonment in the case.

211.title: Govt land worth ₹5 cr freed of encroachments in MP's Jabalpur
211.article_body: The district administration in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur removed encroachments on around 24,340 sq ft of government land on Tuesday. According to an official, the land has a market value of ₹5 crore. These encroachments were removed in joint action by district administration, the police and municipal corporation under state government's initiative, said Additional Collector Namah Shivay Arjaria.

212.title: 2-day-old infant girl found inside Mumbai garbage bin, case lodged
212.article_body: A two-day-old infant girl was found abandoned inside a garbage bin in Mumbai's Mahim area on Tuesday. Following the recovery of the baby, a case has been registered against an unknown person for leaving the infant in the garbage bin near a cloth market area. Police are searching for the accused using CCTV footage.

213.title: US' National Guard may cooperate with Taiwan military: Prez Tsai
213.article_body: Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-wen said on Tuesday that the US' National Guard is mulling cooperation with Taiwan's armed forces. President Tsai's comment comes days after US President Joe Biden pledged that the US will defend Taiwan militarily in case China invades it. Notably, Taiwan has claimed that 30 Chinese warplanes entered its air defence zone on May 30.

214.title: My journey in B'wood has always been hard, difficult: Actress Aishwarya Raj
214.article_body: Actress Aishwarya Raj Bhakuni who will be seen in the upcoming Akshay Kumar starrer 'Samrat Prithviraj', said her journey in Bollywood has "always" been hard and difficult. "When I came to Mumbai, I had no clue where I had to go. I had no godfather," added Aishwarya Raj. "It took me six years to reach here," she stated.

215.title: Not much difference: UP CM after Akhilesh said a child called him Rahul Gandhi
215.article_body: Reacting to Akhilesh Yadav's claim that a child called him Rahul Gandhi when he was the CM, the current UP CM Yogi Adityanath said that there is not much difference between the two. "The only little difference is that Rahul Gandhi criticises India in foreign countries, while you (Akhilesh) do the same for UP when outside the state," he added.

216.title: Students unable to afford high fees going to countries like Ukraine: SC
216.article_body: The students who cannot afford to pay the high cost of medical courses are going to countries such as Ukraine, the Supreme Court said. Education has become a big industry in the country, SC added. The observation was made by the court while hearing a batch of pleas asking the government to process applications for setting up new pharmacy colleges.

217.title: 60-yr-old father, 26-yr-old son found dead in UP's Ballia
217.article_body: A man and his son were found dead in Sonavani village of Uttar Pradesh's Ballia district. The deceased, identified as Uma Shankar Singh (60) and Vikram Singh (26), were found in separate places in the village. Vikram's body was found inside a well while his father Uma's body was found at the family residence, police said.

218.title: 2 killed, 13 injured after minibus fell into gorge in Uttarkashi
218.article_body: Two persons were reportedly killed and 13 injured after a minibus they were travelling in fell into a 100-metre-deep gorge near Kopang Bend in Uttarkashi on Sunday. The deceased have been identified as Alka Bote, a doctor from Maharashtra's Aurangabad and Kartik Madhavan, a journalist from Coimbatore who worked for The Hindu, an official said. They were travelling to Gangotri.

219.title: Zomato shares surge over 48% in May, m-cap nears ₹60,000 crore
219.article_body: Shares of Zomato have surged over 48% in May with its total market capitalisation at ₹59,052 crore after the stock closed at ₹75 on Tuesday. The stock had hit a low of ₹50 apiece on May 11. Last week, Zomato announced its March quarter earnings and reported a loss of ₹360 crore and a 75% increase in consolidated revenue.

220.title: Raj Thackeray hospitalised in Mumbai, to undergo hip surgery tomorrow
220.article_body: Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) chief Raj Thackeray has been admitted to the Lilavati Hospital in Mumbai and he will undergo hip surgery on Wednesday, party leader Nitin Sardesai said. Thackeray had earlier this month said that he will undergo surgery for his knee and back problems. Recently, he had given a deadline to remove loudspeakers from mosques.

221.title: Actor Karan V Grover to tie the knot with Poppy Jabbal on June 1: Reports
221.article_body: Actor Karan V Grover is all set to tie the knot with his longtime actress-girlfriend Poppy Jabbal on June 1, according to reports. The wedding will reportedly take place in Himachal Pradesh in the presence of family members and friends. As per reports, actresses Shama Sikander and Sonnalli Seygall are among the people who have been invited to the wedding.

222.title: Johnny Depp performs with Jeff Beck in UK for second night in a row
222.article_body: Actor Johnny Depp performed with English guitarist Jeff Beck for the second night in a row on Monday at London's Royal Albert Hall. Jeff introduced Johnny saying, "He came knocking on my dressing room door about five years ago and we haven't stopped laughing since." This comes amid the jury's deliberation in Johnny's defamation trial against his ex-wife Amber Heard.

223.title: Can't mention Ronaldinho, Gareth Bale in same sentence: Rio Ferdinand
223.article_body: Ex-Manchester United defender Rio Ferdinand said Real Madrid forward Gareth Bale and ex-Barcelona footballer Ronaldinho's names cannot be mentioned in the same sentence. Ferdinand added that Bale has had a "ridiculous" career, stating he is above Ronaldinho while considering Champions League success. He said the moments Ronaldinho has had in his career will live with generations of people forever.

224.title: BJP will do horse-trading and spoil atmosphere: Gehlot on RS polls
224.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said that BJP will do horse-trading in the upcoming Rajya Sabha elections and spoil atmosphere of the state. "BJP fielded Subhash Chandra. They know they don't have sufficient votes so what will they do," he added. Randeep Singh Surjewala, Mukul Wasnik, and Pramod Tiwari have filed nominations as Congress candidates for Rajya Sabha polls from Rajasthan.

225.title: He has got all these opportunities: CM Nitish on not sending RCP Singh to RS
225.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar commented on his party JD(U)'s decision to not field Union Minister RCP Singh for the next month's Rajya Sabha biennial election. "He (RCP) has been sent to RS twice. He was also made JD(U) President and he is currently a minister in the Central government. So he has got all these opportunities," CM Nitish Kumar said.

226.title: BJP workers march towards TN Secretariat over tax on fuel prices
226.article_body: Tamil Nadu BJP chief K Annamalai and party workers marched towards the state's Secretariat in Chennai in a protest over DMK-led state government not reducing tax on fuel prices on Tuesday. DMK promised to reduce the petrol and diesel prices "by ₹5 and ₹4 respectively" in its manifesto, Annamalai said. "We demand...state government to fulfil what it's promised," he added.

227.title: Man with rifle arrested after standoff with police outside Greek Parliament
227.article_body: A 37-year-old man carrying a hunting rifle has been arrested after a brief standoff with police outside the Greek Parliament. Tuesday's incident lasted a little over an hour and no one was injured, an official said. Last year in October, a 58-year-old man was arrested after driving a pickup truck onto a sidewalk in front of Parliament.

228.title: Many singers in Punjab give money and save themselves from gangsters: Mika Singh
228.article_body: Singer Mika Singh, in an interaction with News18, revealed that many singers in Punjab who are extorted by gangsters often end up paying them off. "Singers in Punjab often get such threats from gangsters...Many singers give money and save themselves," he stated. "Everyone knows they do so many shows and earn well," Mika added.

229.title: Kevin Pietersen picks his Team of IPL 2022, includes 5 overseas players
229.article_body: Former England captain Kevin Pietersen has picked his Team of IPL 2022, which includes five foreign players. He named Jos Buttler and Quinton De Kock as the openers of the team. He included Hardik Pandya as captain. Other players include KL Rahul, Liam Livingstone, Ravichandran Ashwin, David Miller, Rahul Tewatia, Umran Malik, Yuzvendra Chahal and Josh Hazlewood.

230.title: Gyanvapi survey pics & videos leaked, aired on TV after being given to petitioners
230.article_body: After the videos and pictures of the Gyanvapi Mosque survey were handed over to four female Hindu petitioners on Monday, the same were leaked and aired on TV channels and circulated online. The Varanasi district court gave sealed envelopes containing survey footage to the petitioners who submitted an affidavit promising not to leak them. They've denied leaking the footage.

231.title: Was honour to play opposite Sam, Laura & Jeff in 'Jurassic...': Chris
231.article_body: Actor Chris Pratt has said that it was an honour to work opposite Jeff Goldblum, Laura Dern and Sam Neill in 'Jurassic World Dominion'. "I loved Jurassic Park growing up...they were cemented in my mind as icons at a period in my life when I didn't even know what I was going to do for a living," he added.

232.title: Shiba Inu's anonymous Founder Ryoshi deletes all tweets, blogs
232.article_body: Shiba Inu's anonymous Founder Ryoshi has deleted all their tweets and Shiba Inu blogs from Medium website. In a now-deleted post, Ryoshi had said, "I am a nobody, I am not important...I am just some guy of no consequence...and I am replaceable." Rysohi's Twitter profile picture has been changed to include a picture of Buddhist yogi Jetsun Milarepa.

233.title: Delhi court summons Congress' Shivakumar in money laundering case
233.article_body: A Delhi court has summoned Karnataka Congress chief DK Shivakumar in a money laundering case after taking cognisance of a chargesheet filed by ED. The court has directed him to appear before it on July 1. The case pertains to a 2018 chargesheet filed by the Income Tax Department against Shivakumar and others for alleged tax evasion and hawala dealings.

234.title: Siberian tundra could virtually disappear by mid-millennium: Research
234.article_body: As a result of rising temperatures in Arctic due to global warming, the treeline for Siberian larch forests is steadily advancing to the north. Experts warned that Siberian tundra could virtually disappear by mid-millennium as these forests are gradually supplanting the broad expanses of the region. Only consistent climate protection measures could roughly save 30% of the tundra, they said.

235.title: 1 dead, 62 fall sick after drinking contaminated water in K'taka
235.article_body: Raichur Institute of Medical Sciences Superintendent Dr Bhaskar K on Tuesday said one person was dead and 62 others, including 23 children, have been hospitalised after they consumed contaminated water in Karnataka's Raichur city. The people were hospitalised due to dehydration, following vomiting and diarrhoea. Locals alleged that the district administration was not responding to their appeals.

236.title: International institutions accepting poverty is reducing in India: PM
236.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday said that today India extends its hand for help and international institutions are also accepting that poverty is reducing in India. "In COVID-19, we sent medicines and vaccines to over 150 countries," PM Modi said in Shimla. "India has proved that we have the potential and we are also the performers," PM Modi added.

237.title: Singaporeans rush to stock up chicken as Malaysia bans exports
237.article_body: The Singaporeans reportedly rushed to stock up on fresh chicken, clearing out supermarkets, as Malaysia's ban on poultry export is set to kick in from Wednesday. The ban was announced by Malaysian PM Ismail Sabri Yaakob last week in a bid to let domestic prices and production stabilise. Notably, Singapore procures a third of its poultry requirements from Malaysia.

238.title: Salman's security increased after Lawrence Bishnoi accused in Moosewala murder
238.article_body: Actor Salman Khan's security has been increased after gangster Lawrence Bishnoi, who threatened him in 2018, emerged as an accused in the murder of singer Sidhu Moosewala. "Police will be present around [Salman's] apartment (in Mumbai) to make sure no nefarious activity is done," said a police official. Bishnoi had threatened Salman in Rajasthan in retaliation for alleged blackbuck poaching.

239.title: France bans use of English video gaming terms like 'e-sports' and 'streaming'
239.article_body: The French government is officially banning the use of English video gaming terms to preserve the purity of French language. As per the AFP, government officials will now be required to replace words such as 'e-sports' and 'streaming' with their approved French versions. France's Culture Ministry said the use of English terms could become a "barrier to understanding" for non-gamers.

240.title: 5 killed, 5 injured as mini-bus collides with auto-rickshaw in Gujarat
240.article_body: At least five people were killed and five others were injured after a mini-bus collided with an auto-rickshaw in Gujarat's Banaskantha, police said. The deceased include three women, in the age group of 20 to 50 years, a man and a 10-year-old boy, police added. The mini-bus was coming from Rajasthan when it collided head-on with the auto-rickshaw, police stated.

241.title: Report claims Culture Ministry to study 'racial purity' of Indians, govt says 'misleading'
241.article_body: The government on Tuesday said that a media report titled "Culture Ministry to study 'racial purity' of Indians" published on May 28 is misleading, mischievous and contrary to the facts. "The proposal is not related to establishing genetic history and 'trace the purity of races in India' as alluded in the article," the Ministry of Culture said in a statement.

242.title: B'wood has always seen me more as a glamorous person: Sonali
242.article_body: Actress Sonali Bendre has said that the Hindi film industry has always seen her more as a glamorous person than as a serious actor. "I want that to change," she added. Sonali further said she has nothing against glamour and loves being glamorous, while adding, "But there is more to me. And I would like those layers to be explored."

243.title: The team invested 2 years on VFX of 'Samrat Prithviraj': Akshay
243.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar has said that the makers of his upcoming film 'Samrat Prithviraj' invested two years of the pandemic on the VFX work of the film. The actor added that the film is truly a "visual extravaganza" as the "grandest tribute to the fearless king". He had earlier said that his costumes in the film weighed about 4-6 kg.

244.title: There will be 'no entry' for BJP in 2024 Lok Sabha polls: Mamata
244.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said that no matter how much the BJP tries there will be "no entry" for the party in the 2024 Lok Sabha polls. "There are no chances of the BJP returning to power," she said. "The citizens of the country are fed up with the anti-people government at the Centre," she further said.

245.title: Much of acting I know is what he taught me: Rasika on FTII professor Naseeruddin
245.article_body: Actress Rasika Dugal spoke about the opportunity of collaborating with her Film and Television Institute of India (FTII) professor Naseeruddin Shah in 'The Miniaturist of Junagadh'. "One of the reasons was of course Naseer saheb. He taught me when I was [at] FTII and much that I know of acting today is because of what he taught me," she said.

246.title: There is truly no one like you: Mahesh Babu on his father's b'day
246.article_body: Taking to Instagram on Tuesday, actor Mahesh Babu wished his father and veteran actor Krishna on his 79th birthday. "Happy birthday Nanna! There is truly no one like you. Wishing for your happiness and good health for many more years to come. Stay blessed always. Love you," he wrote. Recently, Mahesh had featured in 'Sarkaru Vaari Paata'.

247.title: I didn't click Depp-Heard honeymoon pic, shared it online: Russel Wong
247.article_body: Singaporean photographer Russel Wong shared the honeymoon picture of Johnny Depp and Amber Heard which shows a bruise under Depp's eye. Wong has stated that he did not click the picture, however, he did find the original picture as well as copies which showed Depp's bruise. Heard had claimed in the defamation trial against her that Depp Photoshopped the bruise.

248.title: Before 2014, talks were on scams, 'atki, latki, bhatki' schemes: PM
248.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday claimed that before 2014, talks used to be about things like scams, corruption, nepotism and "atki, latki, bhatki (stuck, hanging, derailed)" schemes. "But today talks are about benefits from govt schemes," he said. PM Modi made the remarks while addressing a meeting in Shimla as BJP-led government marks eight years at the Centre.

249.title: Southwest monsoon likely to reach Karnataka on June 2
249.article_body: The southwest monsoon is likely to reach Karnataka on June 2 (Thursday), the India Meteorological Department has said. The onset of monsoon showers might be delayed by three-four days over southern Karnataka but the entire state can expect rains from June 7, it added. Monsoon reached Kerala on Sunday, three days ahead of its onset.

250.title: 2 men rob Sudanese national of ₹2.72 lakh in Noida's Sector 128
250.article_body: A Sudanese national was robbed of $3,500 (nearly ₹2.72 lakh) by two men in Noida's Sector 128 on Sunday, according to a police official. The men had shown fake police IDs to 35-year-old Abu Bakr and searched him for drugs, the official said. They stole the money from the victim's wallet during the search and fled, the official added.

251.title: Israel signs trade deal with UAE, first-ever with an Arab state
251.article_body: Israel has signed a free trade agreement with the United Arab Emirates (UAE), its first with an Arab country. The pact was signed on Tuesday by both the countries' Economic Ministers. The deal would remove tariffs on 96% of goods. Two-way trade between Israel and the UAE last year totalled some $900 million, according to Israeli figures.

252.title: India's fiscal deficit at 6.7% of GDP in 2021-22
252.article_body: The central government's fiscal deficit stood at 6.7% of the GDP (gross domestic product) for 2021-22, lower than 6.9% estimated by the Ministry of Finance in the revised Budget 2022 estimates. During Budget 2022, the fiscal deficit was revised to ₹15.91 lakh crore. According to data shared on Tuesday, India's fiscal deficit for the financial year was ₹15.87 lakh crore.

253.title: Kerala woman thrashes drunk man in public for molesting her in bus
253.article_body: A video has surfaced online, showing a young woman thrashing a man after the latter allegedly molested and abused her in a public bus in Kerala's Wayanad. As per reports, the man was in a drunken state. The incident took place when the woman, who was on her way to her office, asked him to move to a different seat.

254.title: Sri Lanka's inflation surges to record 39.1% in May amid economic crisis
254.article_body: Amid the nation's worst economic crisis, consumer prices in Sri Lanka’s Colombo in May rose to 39.1% from a year ago, said the Department of Census and Statistics. Meanwhile, food inflation surged 57.4% and non-food items jumped 30.6%, according to the data. Sri Lanka has defaulted on its $51 billion foreign debt and is seeking urgent assistance from the IMF.

255.title: Didn't perform the way we wanted, but excited about next year: MI's Sams
255.article_body: Talking about MI's performance in IPL 2022, all-rounder Daniel Sams said his side didn't perform the way they would've liked. "But we're excited about what's to come next year," he added. Five-time champions MI had their worst-ever season as they finished last in the standings for the first time in their IPL history. MI won four out of 14 matches.

256.title: Noida's Attero to spend $1 bn on battery recycling plants in US, Poland
256.article_body: Noida-based battery recycling company Attero Recycling is planning to invest $1 billion over five years to build lithium-ion battery recycling plants in Poland, the US and Indonesia. It also plans to prepare for an IPO in about a year and list in India or the US, later. Attero's Poland factory will be operational by the fourth quarter of 2022.

257.title: Shopkeeper’s son from village in Maharashtra cracks UPSC exam
257.article_body: A shopkeeper’s son, Rameshwar Sudhakar Sabbanwad, from a village in Maharashtra’s Latur, has cracked the Civil Services Examination, 2021. Sabbanwad, a resident of Handarguli village, secured 202nd rank in the results announced by the Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) on Monday. According to Sabbanwad, he cleared the UPSC exam in his second attempt.

258.title: Security forces destroy 620 acres of opium farming in Bihar in a year
258.article_body: Security forces destroyed 620 acres of opium farming across three districts in Bihar in the past one year, a police official said on Tuesday. Opium farming in Jamui, Aurangabad and Gaya districts is turning out to be major source of revenue for Naxals, he added. "The revenue generated through opium farming is used for purchasing arms and ammunition," he said.

259.title: Sidhu Moosewala came to Mumbai last week, said 'I feel safe here': Mika
259.article_body: Mika Singh, recalling his last conversation with late singer Sidhu Moosewala, shared, "Last week he came to Mumbai, and I offered him my car to travel around in." "He told me, 'Brother, I feel safe here even without a security guard. People aren't staring. There's no tension'," Mika added.

260.title: Most reprehensible act: J&K LG after woman teacher killed in Kulgam
260.article_body: J&K Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha condemned the killing of Rajni Bala, a 36-year-old Kashmiri Pandit teacher who was shot dead by terrorists in Kulgam on Tuesday. "Terrorist attack on...Bala is the most reprehensible act. My deepest condolences to the bereaved family," Sinha's office tweeted. "Terrorists and their sympathizers will be given unforgettable response for dastardly attack," it added.

261.title: 2 Russian soldiers sentenced to 11.5 years in jail over war crimes
261.article_body: A Ukrainian court on Tuesday sentenced two Russian soldiers, found guilty of war crimes, to 11 and a half years in jail. The soldiers - Alexander Bobikin and Alexander Ivanov - were part of an artillery unit that carried out shelling in the Kharkiv region which resulted in the destruction of an educational facility, according to the prosecutors.

262.title: Nirmala Sitharaman files nomination for Rajya Sabha from Karnataka
262.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman filed her nomination for Rajya Sabha elections as BJP candidate from Karnataka's Vidhana Soudha (Legislative Assembly). Prior to filing the nomination, Sitharaman visited the Gavi Gangadhareshwara Temple in Bengaluru. Sitharaman thanked Karnataka BJP leaders for supporting her nomination and said that she will dedicate herself to serving Karnataka.

263.title: PMC announces financial aid for care of mentally disabled people
263.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has announced financial aid for registered voluntary organisations catering to mentally disabled patients in its jurisdiction. Under PMC's 'Disabled Welfare Scheme', annual aid of ₹24,000 will be paid to such organisations to take care of at least 15 mentally challenged persons. The amount may also be paid to parents of children dealing with mental illness.

264.title: We happen to look good together naturally: A$AP Rocky on Rihanna
264.article_body: Rapper A$AP Rocky, speaking about his relationship with Rihanna, said, "I think it's just natural. We happen to look good together naturally." "It would take a lot of work to have us forcefully match before we leave the house," he added. Earlier this month, the duo welcomed a baby boy. Rihanna and Rocky have been dating since early 2020.

265.title: Hardik Pandya's captaincy was similar to Dhoni: Sanjay Manjrekar
265.article_body: Former India batter Sanjay Manjrekar has said that Gujarat Titans skipper Hardik Pandya's captaincy in IPL 2022 was similar to that of MS Dhoni. "Hardik bowled well...He captained the team like MS Dhoni. R Sai Kishore bowled the 16th and 18th overs in the final," Manjrekar noted. He added that Pandya "made the decisions according to match situations".

266.title: Pune Zilla Parishad launches project to upgrade 102 primary health centres
266.article_body: Pune Zilla Parishad has launched a project to upgrade the 102 primary health centres (PHCs) across the district. Furthermore, it plans to add 12 more PHCs. PHCs are the "bedrock of public health", the body's CEO Ayush Prasad said. The CEO also claimed that Pune now has the "most number of PHCs in any district of India."

267.title: Mumbai civic body chief IS Chahal empanelled as Secretary by govt
267.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) Commissioner Iqbal Singh Chahal and Mumbai Port Trust Chairman Rajiv Jalota are among the two senior bureaucrats in Maharashtra who have been empanelled in the rank of Secretary by the central government. Notably, Chahal was earlier praised by the Supreme Court for handling the oxygen crisis during the second wave of COVID-19.

268.title: No one can kill his voice: Arshi Khan on Sidhu Moosewala's killing
268.article_body: Former 'Bigg Boss' contestant and actress Arshi Khan mourned the demise of Sidhu Moosewala, who was shot dead in Punjab's Mansa district on Sunday. "I'm sure no one can kill his voice and he'll be celebrated with his songs," she said. "It wasn't...personal loss but it was a loss for our country," Arshi said, adding, "Culprits must be punished."

269.title: It's as close to winning a WC as you can get: GT's Wade on IPL 2022 triumph
269.article_body: Reacting to his team winning IPL 2022, GT's Matthew Wade said, "It's [as] close to winning a World Cup as you can get. It was a crazy atmosphere and something I'll never forget – 1,04,000 people." "This one has got all the glitz and glamour on it...they do it differently over in India and...put on a show," added Wade.

270.title: Railway police saves man who fell off moving train at Prayagraj station
270.article_body: A Government Railway Police (GRP) Head Constable, Ramu Yadav reportedly saved the life of a man who fell off a moving train at the Prayagraj railway station. The mishap happened when the man was sitting at the gate of a coach. Uttar Pradesh Police also shared a video of the incident on Twitter, hailing Yadav's alertness.

271.title: Philippines protests against China's fishing ban in South China Sea
271.article_body: The Foreign Ministry of the Philippines said that it has filed a diplomatic protest with China for imposing a temporary fishing ban in the country's Exclusive Economic Zone (EEZ) in the South China Sea. The fishing moratorium is aimed at regenerating fish stocks. Notably, China and the Philippines have overlapping territorial claims in the South China Sea.

272.title: Delhi minister Satyendar Jain sent to ED custody till June 9
272.article_body: Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain was on Tuesday sent to the Enforcement Directorate's (ED) custody till June 9 in an alleged money laundering case. This comes after the ED arrested Jain on Monday in the case, which pertains to hawala transactions related to a Kolkata-based company.

273.title: Another home irreparably damaged by violence: Omar on J&K teacher’s killing
273.article_body: After a Kashmiri Pandit teacher was shot dead by terrorists in Jammu and Kashmir, ex-J&K CM Omar Abdullah on Tuesday said that another home has been irreparably damaged by violence. "She lost her life in a despicable targeted attack," Abdullah tweeted. The deceased woman, 36-year-old Rajni Bala, was a resident of Samba in Jammu region.

274.title: LIC share price drops over 3% after its Q4 net profit falls 17%
274.article_body: The share price of Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) dropped over 3% on Tuesday after the insurer's consolidated net profit in the January-March quarter of FY22 dropped 17%. LIC's stock price dropped 3.23% on the BSE and 3.31% on the NSE on Tuesday. The stock price has fallen about 15% from its IPO issue price of ₹949/share.

275.title: I struggle to lift even 2kg at gym post radiotherapy: Chhavi Mittal
275.article_body: Actress Chhavi Mittal has revealed that she struggles to lift even 2 kg dumbells at the gym after undergoing radiotherapy sessions. Chhavi added that she takes her physiotherapy classes at the gym as well. The actress further said, "I want to tell everybody going through something difficult, please just face it with a smile. It makes a lot of difference."

276.title: PMC to mark World Environment Day with cleanliness drive
276.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) will mark World Environment Day this year by organising 'Plogathon 2022 Mega Drive', which will be held on June 5. As many as 134 roads in the city, as well as various hill spots and riverside ghats, will be cleaned during the drive, local media reported. The drive will commence from 7 am onwards, PMC tweeted.

277.title: Police detain 32 foreign nationals for overstaying in Bengaluru
277.article_body: In a special drive, Bengaluru City Police raided several places in the city to find overstaying foreigners and nationals without valid documents, according to a report. During the drive, police detained 32 overstaying foreign nationals, including 19 males and 13 women. All the detained foreign nationals are being questioned and necessary legal action is being taken, a police statement read.

278.title: Moosewala's father stands with folded hands as thousands join singer's funeral march
278.article_body: Sidhu Moosewala's father Balkaur Singh was seen thanking the late singer's thousands of supporters who joined his funeral procession in his native village in Punjab on Tuesday. Singh was seen standing on the tractor carrying Moosewala's mortal remains, with folded hands. The 28-year-old singer and Congress leader was cremated in the presence of his family and fans.

279.title: Why did Enforcement Directorate arrest Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain?
279.article_body: Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain was arrested by the Enforcement Directorate on Monday in an alleged money laundering case. The agency alleged that Jain was involved in hawala transactions with a Kolkata-based firm in 2015-16. Earlier, the CBI alleged that Jain and his family set up four shell firms to launder ₹11.78 crore in 2010-12 and ₹4.63 crore in 2015-16.

280.title: Moosewala's father holds his turban in his hands to thank crowd at son's cremation
280.article_body: Late singer Sidhu Moosewala's father held his turban in his hands to thank thousands of people who had gathered at village Moosa in Punjab's Mansa for his son's cremation. Sidhu Moosewala was cremated in his agricultural field instead of the village cremation ground. He was shot dead on May 29.

281.title: Ranbir's fans get crane to put garland on him in Visakhapatnam, video surfaces
281.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor and director Ayan Mukerji on Tuesday flew off to Visakhapatnam to promote their upcoming film 'Brahmastra'. A video has surfaced online showing a massive garland made of marigold flowers being placed around Ranbir with the help of a crane. Ranbir and Ayan were also showered with flower petals as soon as they stepped out of the airport.

282.title: Looking forward to watching with family: Aamir on sister Nikhat's TV debut
282.article_body: Aamir Khan took to the official Instagram handle of his production house to congratulate his sister Nikhat Khan who'll make her TV debut with the show 'Banni Chow Home Delivery'. "My very best wishes to Nikhat...Looking forward to watching with my family. Love...Aamir," he wrote. Nikhat has previously appeared in films like 'Lahore Confidential' and 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior'.

283.title: BJP-led central government 'adulterated', destroying economy: Mamata
283.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee called the BJP-led central government "adulterated" and accused it of mismanaging country's economy. "They've destroyed...country's economy through disastrous decisions like demonetisation. It was a big scam," she said while addressing a meeting of TMC workers in Purulia district on Tuesday. She added that BJP is trying to silence opposition through central agencies.

284.title: YouTuber raises ₹33 lakh funds for temple renovation without permission in TN, held
284.article_body: Police arrested a Tamil Nadu-based YouTuber, Karthik Gopinath, for allegedly illegally raising funds over ₹33 lakh for the renovation of temples controlled by the state government without permission. He also collected money in his personal account, police added. The complainant, an official of a temple in Siruvachur, alleged Gopinath wrongfully used the money for his own purpose.

285.title: Old video of Sidhu Moosewala saying 'I am targeted, might die any day' surfaces
285.article_body: An old video of singer-politician Sidhu Moosewala has surfaced online wherein he talked about death. "I don't have a specific aim in life. I have been targeted many times. I might die any day but I am not scared of death," he had said in the video. Moosewala was shot dead on Sunday.

286.title: CCI probing alleged nexus between e-comm firms, their sellers: Report
286.article_body: Competition Commission of India's (CCI) investigation arm is reviewing documents that suggest financial dealings between leading e-commerce companies and their preferred sellers, the Economic Times reported. The documents were reportedly found during raids on vendors last month following allegations that Amazon and Flipkart violated competition law. The CCI arm has sought time to review documents.

287.title: I ensured that I live each moment to the fullest at Cannes: Hina Khan
287.article_body: Actress Hina Khan, speaking about her experience at Cannes Film Festival 2022, has said, "Once I was there, there was so much happening." She added, "I ensured that I live each moment to the fullest and enjoy my time there and not just rush through it." Hina unveiled the poster of her film 'Country of Blind' at the film festival.

288.title: Don't like night matches on clay: Nadal on QF match timings against Djokovic
288.article_body: Spain's Rafael Nadal has commented on the night session timings during which his French Open quarter-final match against Serbia's Novak Djokovic is scheduled to be played on Tuesday. "I don't like to play on clay during the night because the humidity is higher, the ball is slower and there can be very heavy conditions especially when it's cold," Nadal said.

289.title: Sidhu Moosewala's murder symbolic of AAP's 'misgovernance': Lekhi
289.article_body: Union Minister and BJP leader Meenakashi Lekhi on Tuesday criticised the AAP-led Punjab government over Punjabi singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala's murder. "This is not the first murder, it is the 90th murder since they (AAP) have come to power," Lekhi claimed. She further alleged that the murder was "symbolic of misgovernance going on in the state".

290.title: Water supply to be disrupted in Hyderabad for 24 hours on June 1
290.article_body: The water supply in parts of Hyderabad will be disrupted for 24 hours from 6 am on June 1 (Wednesday). The water cut has been scheduled due to repair work on freshwater supply lines, the Hyderabad Metropolitan Water Supply and Sewerage Board announced. The affected areas include Gandipet, Narsingi, Manchirevula, Manikonda and Kokapet.

291.title: Turkey summons German & French envoys over Kurdish militant events
291.article_body: Turkish Foreign Minister Mevlut Cavusoglu said the German and French ambassadors to Ankara were summoned to the country's Foreign Ministry to protest events organised by the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK) in those nations. Turkey, US and the European Union consider PKK a terrorist organisation. Separately, Turkey has said it opposes Sweden and Finland's NATO bids for harbouring Kurdish militants.

292.title: Hardik was a big gamble by GT, Miller a massive one: Sanjay Manjrekar
292.article_body: Talking about GT's IPL 2022 triumph having beaten RR in the final, cricketer-turned-commentator Sanjay Manjrekar said, "[Captain] Hardik Pandya [was a] big gamble, [batter] David Miller [a] massive gamble." "What [a] return from these guys," added Manjrekar. Hardik scored 487 runs and picked eight wickets in IPL 2022. Miller scored 481 runs at a strike rate of 142.72.

293.title: Biplab Deb's removal as CM proves BJP govt is non-performing: TMC
293.article_body: TMC General Secretary Kunal Ghosh on Monday asked the BJP to reveal why former Tripura CM Biplab Deb was removed from his post. "The removal of Biplab Kumar Deb has substantiated the Trinamool Congress' allegation that the BJP dispensation is a non-performing government," he said. Notably, BJP's Manik Saha was recently named as CM of Tripura.

294.title: After not being fielded for RS, Naqvi likely to contest LS polls: Report
294.article_body: Minority Affairs Minister Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi is likely to be fielded by the BJP for the Lok Sabha bypolls from the Rampur constituency, ANI reported. Notably, Naqvi, whose Rajya Sabha tenure is going to end in July 2022, has not been listed by the BJP as its candidate for the Rajya Sabha biennial election scheduled for June 10.

295.title: Unusual to have such massive snowfall: Zarina on shooting for Ishq Pashmina
295.article_body: Speaking about shooting for the film Ishq Pashmina, actress Zarina Wahab said that it was unusual to have such a massive snowfall. "I've worked outstations and experienced weather problems before, but this was something I hadn't experienced," she added. "Locals came to our aid, whether it was clearing the snow or ensuring...the areas were always clear for us," Zarina said.

296.title: 6 members of interstate gang involved in train thefts arrested in Pune
296.article_body: The Pune Rural Police has busted an interstate gang from Delhi and Haryana that was involved in several bag-lifting cases and cellphone thefts in railway stations and trains across India. Six members of the gang have been arrested. Police recovered fake Aadhaar cards, stolen cellphones, 48 SIM cards and a cutter used to break chains from their possession.

297.title: Indian-American Congressman honoured with Distinguished Leadership Award
297.article_body: Indian-American Congressman Raja Krishnamoorthi has been honoured with the Distinguished Leadership Award in recognition of his outstanding career and dedication to public service. Illinois State Secretary Jesse White presented the award to the Democratic leader. Krishnamoorthi, who was born in New Delhi, has been serving as US representative for Illinois' 8th congressional district since 2017.

298.title: Lawrence Bishnoi moves Delhi HC fearing 'fake encounter' in Moosewala killing
298.article_body: A day after a court refused to entertain Lawrence Bishnoi's plea to stop the transfer of his custody to Punjab Police, the jailed gangster approached the Delhi High Court. Bishnoi, who is a suspect in singer Sidhu Moosewala's killing, has alleged he feared a fake encounter by Punjab Police. He is currently lodged in Delhi's Tihar Jail.

299.title: Got married too young, I understand marriage better now: Kanika
299.article_body: Singer Kanika Kapoor, who recently got married to businessman Gautam Hathiramani, has spoken about her first marriage. She said, "I got married earlier at a very young age and today I understand this institution much better." Kanika further said that sometimes one can be in a marriage with a partner who doesn't understand you, adding that it's not anybody's fault.

300.title: Nigerian drug peddler held in B'luru, drugs worth ₹8 lakh seized
300.article_body: The Central Crime Branch (CCB) of Bengaluru City Police has arrested a Nigerian drug peddler and seized drugs worth ₹8 lakh from his possession, the city's Joint Commissioner of Police (Crime), Raman Gupta, said on Tuesday. The seized drugs include 60 grams of MDMA crystals and six grams of cocaine. Police have also recovered a mobile phone from his possession.

301.title: Sidhu Moosewala cremated in his native village in Punjab, thousands attend funeral
301.article_body: Singer-politician Sidhu Moosewala, who was shot dead on Sunday, was cremated in his native village Moosa in Punjab's Mansa district on Tuesday, with thousands attending his funeral. As per the police, Goldy Brar, a member of Lawrence Bishnoi gang hailing from Canada, has claimed responsibility of Moosewala's murder. Moosewala's family has sought a CBI probe in the killing.

302.title: Hyd police detain house burglar in drive against habitual offenders
302.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police on Monday detained a "notorious" inter-state house burglar under the PD Act in a drive against habitual offenders. The accused and his associate have been robbing houses in Karnataka, Telangana and Andhra Pradesh since 2017, police said. In April, police had recovered ornaments, phones, cash and a car worth a total of ₹32 lakh from the accused.

303.title: 250 coffins with mummies unearthed in Egypt, pics surface
303.article_body: Egypt on Monday displayed a trove of ancient artefacts dating back 2,500 years that the country's antiquities authorities said were recently unearthed at necropolis of Saqqara near Cairo. The find includes 250 coffins with well-preserved mummies inside, 150 bronze statues of ancient deities and bronze vessels used in rituals. The objects date back to the Late Period, about 500 BC.

304.title: Speedily hear Anil Deshmukh's plea seeking bail, SC to Bombay HC
304.article_body: The Supreme Court (SC) asked the Bombay HC to expeditiously hear ex-Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh's plea seeking bail in a money laundering case. Deshmukh told SC that his bail plea has been pending for hearing since March 25 in the Bombay HC. The SC asked him to file application in HC for an early hearing of his pending plea.

305.title: 52-yr-old woman killed in elephant attack in Chhattisgarh's Surajpur
305.article_body: A 52-year-old woman died in an elephant attack in Chhattisgarh's Surajpur district on Monday evening. The animal attacked the deceased, identified as Indarmania, near Karanjwar Sarhari village where she had gone with two other women to collect wood, an official said. While the other two women managed to escape, the elephant caught Indarmania and trampled her to death, he added.

306.title: Voting to decide U'khand CM Dhami's fate underway in Champawat
306.article_body: Voting for the by-election to Champawat Assembly seat in Uttarakhand is underway which will decide the fate of CM Pushkar Singh Dhami, who had lost from the Khatima seat during state elections. "A new history of Champawat will be created today by 100 per cent voting," Dhami said. The counting of votes will take place on June 3.

307.title: Quality stocks of mangoes in Pune to be over by June 1st week: Traders
307.article_body: Mango season in Pune is likely to shorten as farmers and traders claim that the quality stock of mangoes in the city is likely to get over by first week of June. The traders alleged that unseasonal rain in Pune's two main mango procurement regions, namely the Konkan coast and Karnataka, has led to a major shortfall in produce.

308.title: Woman jumps with her 2-yr-old daughter into well in Rajasthan, both dead
308.article_body: A 25-year-old woman and her two-year-old daughter died after she jumped into a well with the minor in Rajasthan's Sawai Madhopur district. The woman had a quarrel with her husband and her in-laws on Monday following which she left the house with her child, police said. The well is located around two kilometres away from the house's location, police added.

309.title: My life can be divided into life before & after Baahubali: Sathyaraj
309.article_body: Actor Sathyaraj, who played Kattappa in the 'Baahubali' franchise, has said, "For me, life can be divided into life before and after Baahubali." Sathyaraj revealed that before 'Baahubali' people from South India only knew him. "After this character happened, everybody knows me," he added. The actor further revealed he does get offers to work in Hindi films.

310.title: I have seen a time when people didn't know I existed: Flora Saini
310.article_body: Actress Flora Saini has said that following the success of her show 'Gandii Baat', she was offered a lot of roles along the same lines. "That was a big compliment. I have seen a time when people didn't know I existed," she added. "Now everybody knows. I had said no to a lot of work post that," Flora further said.

311.title: SRK & I hit it off immediately, was like meeting an old friend: Farah
311.article_body: Discussing her bond with Shah Rukh Khan, director-choreographer Farah Khan said, "Shah Rukh and I hit it off immediately. It was like meeting an old friend." "We had the same sense of humour. We used to read the same kind of books," added Farah. "Aamir Khan was a big star when...[we] worked...on 'Jo Jeeta Wohi Sikandar'," stated Farah.

312.title: Personally studied ED case against Satyendar, it's fake: Kejriwal
312.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday said that he's "personally studied" the Enforcement Directorate (ED) money laundering case against AAP leader Satyendar Jain and it's "completely fake". "We neither tolerate corruption nor [do we do] corruption. We've a very honest government," he added. Kejriwal also gave the example of AAP-led Punjab government dismissing its minister over corruption charges.

313.title: Delhi's road beautification work to be completed by Sept-Oct: Kejriwal
313.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal inspected road beautification work being carried out in Pitampura area and said that the pilot project is expected to be completed by September-October. "We are trying to beautify roads in Delhi. Our target is to beautify 500 km of roads under PWD, for which we are planning to start our pilot project," he said.

314.title: Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala's parents bid final goodbye to son; pic surfaces
314.article_body: Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala's parents on Tuesday bade final goodbye to their son at their residence in Mansa. Moosewala was shot dead by assailants on Sunday. His father Balkaur Singh claimed in his FIR that he witnessed the fatal attack on his son, saying that the assailants opened indiscriminate firing from Corolla and Bolero cars on the singer.

315.title: Sidhu Moosewala was to get married to Canadian fiancée in November: Report
315.article_body: Late singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala, who was shot dead in Punjab on Sunday, was to turn 29 years old on June 17. As per a report, the singer was due to get married in November. It added that Sidhu was engaged to Amandeep Kaur, a Canadian PR and their match was fixed around two years ago.

316.title: PM transfers ₹21,000 cr to over 10 cr farmers under PM-KISAN scheme
316.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday transferred ₹21,000 crore to over 10 crore beneficiary farmers under the Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi (PM-KISAN) scheme during his visit to Himachal Pradesh's Shimla. This is the 11th instalment under the PM-KISAN scheme. The event, organised at Ridge Maidan, marks the eighth anniversary of the NDA government at the Centre.

317.title: 2 dead, around 20 injured after cars crash into pedestrians in US
317.article_body: Two women were killed and at least 19 were injured after two cars crashed into a crowd of pedestrians while an annual Memorial Day weekend cruise night was wrapping up in US' Nebraska on Sunday night. The deceased women were inside one of two cars involved in crash. So far, there's no evidence it was an "intentional act", police said.

318.title: BCCI announces ₹1.25-crore reward for IPL 2022 curators, groundstaff
318.article_body: The BCCI announced a reward of ₹1.25 crore for curators and groundstaff who helped in conducting IPL 2022. "We've witnessed some high octane games...I'd like to thank each one of them for their hard work," BCCI Secretary Jay Shah tweeted. In IPL 2022, 70 league matches were held across Mumbai and Pune, while playoffs were held in Kolkata and Ahmedabad.

319.title: Ex-J&K CM Farooq Abdullah reaches ED office in Srinagar
319.article_body: National Conference chief and ex-J&K CM Farooq Abdullah on Tuesday reached the Enforcement Directorate (ED) office in Srinagar. The ED had issued a summon to Abdullah in connection with a money laundering case at its headquarters in Delhi today. The case pertains to alleged financial irregularities in the Jammu and Kashmir Cricket Association (JKCA).

320.title: Bradley Cooper's 1st look as Bernstein in 'Maestro' out, fans react
320.article_body: Bradley Cooper's first look as Broadway composer Leonard Bernstein in the film 'Maestro' is out. Bradley can be seen with white hair and glasses in the picture. Several Twitter users reacted to Bradley's look. A user wrote, "The makeup on Bradley as Bernstein in Maestro is insane." "I hope Bradley wins the best actor Oscar one day," another user wrote.

321.title: Singer Karan Aujla pens note after Sidhu Moosewala's death, says 'I know how it feels'
321.article_body: Singer Karan Aujla penned a note on Instagram after the death of Sidhu Moosewala. "I don't feel like doing or saying anything...I am missing my parents very much...I know how it feels when a son is taken away from his parents. I can't put in words how it feels," Aujla wrote without mentioning Moosewala.

322.title: PM Modi holds massive roadshow in Shimla to mark 8 yrs of his govt
322.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi held a massive roadshow in Shimla to mark the eighth anniversary of Bharatiya Janata Party's government at centre. "Today is...very special day in my life. I am privileged that I was given a chance to honour my motherland," PM Modi said. "I am thankful to...all who have come in...large number to bestow their blessings," he added.

323.title: Moosewala's fans shout slogans against Punjab govt outside his residence, lathicharged
323.article_body: The police on Tuesday resorted to lathicharging fans outside the residence of singer Sidhu Moosewala at his village in Punjab's Mansa. Security was strengthened in the area as fans shouted slogans against the Punjab government and the police, demanding death for his murderers. Moosewala will be cremated at his agricultural field, The Indian Express reported.

324.title: Most comfortable being a filmmaker: Kangana as she begins prep for Emergency
324.article_body: Kangana Ranaut has started working on her upcoming directorial 'Emergency'. She took to her Instagram Stories to share pictures from her recce and mentioned she's most comfortable being a filmmaker. "Of all the roles I play, I am most comfortable in being a filmmaker," she wrote. 'Emergency' has been written by Ritesh Shah, who also penned the dialogues of 'Dhaakad'.

325.title: SRK attends friend's wedding in Mumbai, says 'She's taken care of me'
325.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan recently attended the wedding festivities of his friend, Red Chillies Entertainment Supervising Producer Bella Mulchandani in Mumbai. In a video shared by The Con Artists on Instagram, Shah Rukh said, "Bella is my oldest...friends, co-workers. The sweetest thing about her is that she's taken care of me."

326.title: Rohan Bopanna enters his first-ever French Open men's doubles semi-finals
326.article_body: India's Rohan Bopanna has reached his first-ever French Open semi-finals after defeating Lloyd Glasspool and Harri Heliovaara in the men's doubles quarter-finals. Bopanna along with his Dutch partner Matwe Middelkoop won with a scoreline of 4-6, 6-4, 7-6 (10-3). Notably, this will be Bopanna's first semi-final appearance in a Grand Slam doubles event in seven years.

327.title: Mexico accepts US request to probe Panasonic's labour practices
327.article_body: The Mexican government has accepted a US request to probe alleged labour abuses at a Panasonic auto parts plant in the city of Reynosa. Panasonic has been accused of signing a union contract behind workers' backs and of firing several dozen employees who protested. Panasonic has said it will cooperate with Mexican authorities.

328.title: Gurugram court acquits 9 in murder case over 'poor investigation'
328.article_body: A Gurugram court acquitted all nine persons accused in a 2016 murder case over "poor investigation" after prosecution witnesses denied identifying the accused. "Benefit of the doubt is extended to the accused," the court added. "The facts...don't show...police made any effort to join the independent witness at the time of recording the alleged disclosure statements of the accused," it stated.

329.title: 30 Chinese aircraft enter Taiwan air zone, 2nd largest incursion this year
329.article_body: China on Monday made the second-largest incursion into Taiwan's Air Defence Identification Zone (ADIZ) this year, with Taipei reporting 30 aircraft, including 22 fighter jets, entering the area. Taiwan in response sent aircraft and deployed air defence missile systems to track the Chinese planes, Taiwan's Defence Ministry said. Thirty-nine Chinese military planes had entered ADIZ on January 23.

330.title: McCullum will bring heart-on-the-sleeve type of play into England: Gary Stead
330.article_body: Ahead of their three-Test series against England, New Zealand head coach Gary Stead said England's newly appointed Test team coach Brendon McCullum will bring the "heart-on-the-sleeve type of play" into England's squad. "I'm sure McCullum will have some impact but whether that's right now or in the future, who knows?" added Stead. The first Test will begin on June 2.

331.title: Subhash Chandra files nomination from Rajasthan for Rajya Sabha polls
331.article_body: Rajya Sabha MP and Zee TV's Founder Subhash Chandra filed his nomination for Rajya Sabha elections as an independent candidate on Tuesday. Chandra's candidature has been backed by BJP and he also met ex-Rajasthan CM Vasundhara Raje during his visit to the state. Chandra's tenure as a Rajya Sabha MP from Haryana will end on August 1.

332.title: Akshay was going through low phase when I entered his career: Andaaz producer
332.article_body: Director-producer Suneel Darshan who produced Akshay Kumar starrer 'Andaaz' said Akshay was going through a "low" phase, when he entered his career. "Then 'Jaanwar' happened and it worked exceptionally well for his career," added Darshan. "I had promised him...we'll do a hundred movies together," he stated. "We...managed to do seven films together, which is a tall order," said Darshan.

333.title: Ghaziabad generates ₹22 lakh revenue in May by selling solid waste
333.article_body: Ghaziabad Municipal Corporation generated an income of ₹22 lakh in May by selling leftover materials such as plastic, rubber and glass from daily collection of solid waste, the officials said. The corporation collects solid waste with the help of 500 door-to-door collection vehicles in 100 residential wards. The city generates 1,000-1,200 metric tonnes of solid waste on a daily basis.

334.title: Assam to spend ₹1,000 cr on infrastructure development in sports sector
334.article_body: Assam government has decided to spend around ₹1,000 crore for infrastructure development in state's sports sector, Minister of Sports and Youth Welfare Bimal Borah said on Tuesday. "We've decided to construct a multipurpose stadium in 40 assembly constituencies...the cost of each stadium will be around ₹12 crore," Borah said. Ten district level sports complexes will also be constructed, he added.

335.title: 'Major' is an emotion, it is my life's best work: Adivi Sesh
335.article_body: Actor Adivi Sesh, speaking about his upcoming film 'Major', has said, "Major is not a film that can be taken just as a film, it is an emotion, it is my life's best work." The film, directed by Sashi Kiran Tikka, is based on Major Sandeep Unnikrishnan who was martyred in the 26/11 attacks in Mumbai in 2008.

336.title: Road over bridge in Hyderabad's Kaithalapur to open for public by mid-June
336.article_body: The road over bridge (RoB) in Hyderabad's Kaithalapur will open to the public by mid-June, the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) informed on Monday. The four-lane bridge will serve as a significant link between Kukatpally and HITEC city. "Citizens of Sanath Nagar, Bala Nagar and Secunderabad will save one hour of travel time and 3.50 km of distance," GHMC added.

337.title: 4 killed as German plane crashes in Croatia
337.article_body: All four people aboard a German plane were killed after the aircraft crashed near Zagreb in Croatia. The plane, which was flying from Croatia's Split city to Germany's Leverkusen, disappeared from the radar on Sunday. "As soon as the plane was spotted from above [by a drone], search teams went to the scene," said a civil defence official.

338.title: J&K Panthers Party chief Bhim Singh passes away, PM condoles demise
338.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir National Panthers Party (JKNPP) founder and chief Professor Bhim Singh died at the age of 80 on Tuesday morning. According to reports, Singh was unwell for more than a year. Condoling his demise, PM Modi tweeted, "Prof Bhim Singh Ji will be remembered as a grassroots leader who devoted his life for...welfare of Jammu and Kashmir."

339.title: Sidhu Moosewala's body to be taken for last rites on his favourite tractor; pics surface
339.article_body: Late singer Sidhu Moosewala's body will be taken for last rites on his favourite tractor, the HMT 5911, with pictures of the tractor surfacing on social media. As per police, a member of Lawrence Bishnoi's gang has claimed responsibility for Moosewala's murder. Earlier, a CCTV footage surfaced online which reportedly shows men who were allegedly involved in Moosewala's killing.

340.title: Germany to offer protection to Russians opposing Ukraine war
340.article_body: Germany has decided to ease the residence permit procedure for Russians who are facing political persecution for opposing the attack on Ukraine. German Minister Nancy Faeser said that Russia's aggression against Ukraine is accompanied by repression against the press, human rights activists and opposition figures. We will offer protection to those who are persecuted and threatened, she added.

341.title: Actress Dipti Dhyani shaves off her head after husband Sooraj Thapar's COVID-19 recovery
341.article_body: Actress Dipti Dhyani shaved off her head for her husband Sooraj Thapar. Dipti had pledged to offer her hair at Tirupati Balaji while Sooraj was in ICU last year after contracting COVID-19. Sharing a picture on Instagram, Dipti wrote, "Sathi tere naam ek din jeevan kar jaayenge." "She said my life mattered more to her than her hair," Sooraj said.

342.title: Mahindra & Mahindra shares hit record high of ₹1,033 after Q4 results
342.article_body: Shares of Mahindra and Mahindra hit a record high of ₹1,033 apiece on the BSE during Tuesday’s intraday trading. On Saturday, the company reported a nearly five-fold jump in its standalone profit of ₹1,192 crore for the quarter that ended on March 31, 2022, as compared to ₹245 crore profit posted for the year-ago period, it said in a statement.

343.title: Hyd woman asks 5 men to rape partner's friend over suspicion of affair, films act
343.article_body: Hyderabad police have arrested a woman named Gayatri and five men for the alleged gang-rape of another woman. According to reports, Gayatri allegedly asked the men to sexually assault her partner's friend over suspicions that the latter was involved with her partner. Gayatri allegedly filmed the incident and threatened to upload the video on the internet.

344.title: Thundershowers likely in Delhi today, clear skies for rest of the week: IMD
344.article_body: Light rainfall or thundershowers are likely to be witnessed in the afternoon or evening today in Delhi, IMD said. However, clear skies and strong winds are predicted for the remaining part of the week. On Tuesday, the maximum temperature is forecasted to be around 40°C while for the rest of the week, it will be around 42°C, IMD predicted.

345.title: Some episodes are good, some are bad: George on GoT finale criticism
345.article_body: Author George RR Martin has reacted to the criticism of season eight of 'Game of Thrones'. He said, "Some episodes are good, some are bad. Why are people getting so crazy about it?" He added, "I don't understand how people can come to hate so much something that they once loved...How has everything become so toxic?"

346.title: You made Moosewala village look cooler than any city: Pak singer Bilal on Moosewala
346.article_body: Condoling the demise of Sidhu Moosewala, Pakistani singer Bilal Saeed wrote on Instagram, "I will always remember you from your first song 'So high', a true artist and a game changer." He added, "The way you revolutionised desi music, it was a show to watch. So original that Moosewala pind looked cooler than any city in the world."

347.title: MI fans will feel the pain: Ajay Jadeja on Hardik's success as captain
347.article_body: Talking about Hardik Pandya's captaincy having helped his team GT clinch IPL 2022, ex-India cricketer Ajay Jadeja said, "If there is any pain, it will be felt by the [MI] fans." "[Hardik] is one of those who gets inspired by the crowd," added Ajay. Hardik was released by MI ahead of the IPL mega auction having joined them in 2015.

348.title: Removing ranking points from Wimbledon not a great move: Murray
348.article_body: Britain's Andy Murray has said that taking away the ranking points from Wimbledon by the ATP and WTA Tours is not a "great move". "If it doesn't stop players from playing then I don't think it's a great move," Murray said. Notably, the points were taken away due to Wimbledon's decision to ban Russian and Belarusian players from the tournament.

349.title: Man drowns in waterlogged railway underpass at Delhi's Pul Prahladpur
349.article_body: A man reportedly died after he slipped and fell into a waterlogged railway underpass at southeast Delhi's Pul Prahladpur on Monday night. The deceased has not been identified yet but he was aged around 45-50 and had a tattoo on his hand that said 'Kiran, I love you,' police said. "The area was waterlogged due to heavy rainfall," police added.

350.title: Samsung to shut LCD panel manufacturing over reduced profits: Report
350.article_body: Samsung is reportedly planning to shut down its LCD panel manufacturing amid competition with its Chinese and Taiwanese counterparts. As per a report, Samsung Display will focus on manufacturing OLED and QD panels, and its employees are expected to be transferred to the QD business. Reportedly, the main reason for the shutting down of LCD panel production is reduced profits.

351.title: 12 people drown in a day in separate incidents in Guj; 1 missing
351.article_body: As many as 12 people drowned in three separate incidents in Gujarat on Monday.
