In Bhavnagar, four people drowned in the Rojki dam, while in Narmada, five of a family, including a child, drowned in the Karjan river. Furthermore, three youths drowned and one went missing while swimming at the Suvali Beach in Surat. One person was rescued in Surat.

352.title: Hardik Patel to join BJP on June 2 after quitting Congress
352.article_body: Gujarat Patidar leader Hardik Patel, who recently quit Congress, confirmed to ANI that he will join BJP on June 2. In his resignation letter, Patel had said, "Be it the Ram Mandir in Ayodhya, revocation of Article 370 from Jammu and Kashmir, implementation of GST - India wanted solutions...Congress only played the role of roadblock." Patel joined Congress in 2019.

353.title: Will groom Riyan to become more of a middle-order player: Sangakkara
353.article_body: RR's Director of Cricket Kumar Sangakkara has said Riyan Parag has got "potential" and they want to groom him as a middle-order batter from the next IPL season. "Riyan is accomplished against spin as well as pace...I look forward to kind of grooming him to become more of an early middle-order player rather than just a death-hitter," stated Sangakkara.

354.title: Waqar Younis comes to mind when I think of Umran Malik: Brett Lee
354.article_body: Former Australia pacer Brett Lee has said SRH pacer Umran Malik reminds him of former Pakistan pacer Waqar Younis. "Umran has got a lot of pace to burn. He's a competitor, a top guy, who runs in like a lot of pacers from the past," added Lee. Umran ended IPL 2022 with 22 wickets from 14 games.

355.title: Haasan's 'Vikram' earns over ₹200 cr from pre-release business: Reports
355.article_body: Kamal Haasan's upcoming movie 'Vikram', which also stars Fahadh Faasil and Vijay Sethupathi, has reportedly earned over ₹200 crore days before its release. According to film trade analyst Ramesh Bala, the film's satellite and OTT rights in multiple languages have been sold for record prices. Directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj, the action-thriller film will release on June 3.

356.title: Moosewala’s cousin, friend out of danger after undergoing surgery
356.article_body: Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala’s cousin and a friend, who were accompanying him and sustained bullet injuries in the attack on them, underwent surgery at a hospital in Ludhiana. Their condition was critical when they were brought to the hospital. "They are out of danger but have suffered multiple fractures as the bullets hit their bones," a doctor said.

357.title: Called off Azadi March to avoid imminent bloodshed: Imran Khan
357.article_body: Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan said he ended the 'Azadi March' last week to avoid "imminent bloodshed" after clashes between his party workers and police started escalating in Islamabad. He added that PM Shehbaz Sharif-led government would've been the ultimate beneficiary of any ensuing chaos and violence. Khan also admitted that his party workers at the rally "were carrying pistols".

358.title: 36-year-old Kashmiri Pandit teacher dies after terrorists fire upon her in Kulgam
358.article_body: A Kashmiri Pandit teacher at a High School in Gopalpora area of Kulgam in Kashmir was shot dead by terrorists on Tuesday, Kashmir Zone Police said. The deceased woman was identified as 36-year-old Rajni Bala, a resident of Samba in Jammu region. "Terrorists involved in this gruesome terror crime will be soon identified and neutralised," police added.

359.title: Cong leader criticises Jairam going door-to-door to give invites; he responds
359.article_body: Himachal Pradesh Congress chief Pratibha Singh criticised state CM Jairam Thakur for going door-to-door to invite people to 'Garib Kalyan Sammelan' programme, saying that his actions were "below the dignity of the CM". Thakur responded to Singh's remark, saying that he's a "common man" and questioned how he'd lowered his dignity. The programme will be held in Shimla.

360.title: Black ink, deadly attack can't suppress farmers' voices: Tikait
360.article_body: Bhartiya Kisan Union (BKU) leader Rakesh Tikait, who was attacked with black ink during a press conference in Bengaluru on Monday, said that black ink and deadly attack cannot suppress the voice of farmers, labourers, Dalits, the exploited, backwards and tribals of this country. "The fight will continue till the last breath," the farmer leader said in a tweet.

361.title: TMC leader Kunal Ghosh gets bail over comment on Goddess Sita
361.article_body: A Tripura court on Monday granted bail to TMC leader Kunal Ghosh over his alleged comment on Goddess Sita. "If Lord Ram is the ultimate then why did his wife Sita have such a tragic end?" Ghosh had said. Following the TMC spokesperson's comments, a chargesheet was filed against him by five police stations for allegedly hurting Hindu sentiments.

362.title: Most areas of Pune to face water cuts on Thursday due to repair works
362.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has announced that most of the areas in the city, including Karvenagar, Kothrud, Deccan, Shivajinagar, Pune Cantonment, Solapur Road and Kirkee, will face water cuts due to repair and maintenance works. It would be restored the next day, PMC added. PMC had earlier cancelled the planned water cuts in view of the President's visit.

363.title: 44.1% of men, 8.4% of women above 15 yrs consume tobacco in UP: NFHS
363.article_body: Around 44.1% of men and 8.4% of women, above the age of 15 years, consume some form of tobacco in UP, according to NFHS-5 data. “When someone lights a cigarette or a bidi, 30% of smoke goes into his lungs and the remaining 70% hovers around and is inhaled by others,” Dr Surya Kant, state tobacco control cell member, said.

364.title: You are lucky that people treat you as relevant: Saif Ali Khan
364.article_body: Saif Ali Khan, speaking about staying relevant in films after 30 years in the industry, said, "It starts with the thinking...then you are lucky that people treat you as relevant." Talking about his looks at the age of 51, Saif stated, "I have my mum's (Sharmila Tagore) young genes...it's a cross between that and a healthy outlook on life."

365.title: Speeding truck hits workers painting road markings in Pune; 1 dead
365.article_body: One worker was killed and four others seriously injured after a speeding truck hit them while they were painting road markings in Pune's Ravet on Monday. A search has been launched to catch the truck driver who escaped from the scene, a police officer said. "The workers also got injured as hot paint splashed on them," the police officer added.

366.title: Was surprised to see RR bat first, don't know why: Sachin on IPL final
366.article_body: Discussing the IPL 2022 final where GT defeated RR by seven wickets, Sachin Tendulkar said, "Rajasthan won the toss and surprisingly batted first...I don't know why." "I believe that had Rajasthan bowled first, the pressure would have been on Gujarat," added Tendulkar. Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan had stated that RR were "timid" in their approach in the IPL 2022 final.

367.title: 2 IndiGo planes avoid mid-air collision after take-off at same time; ATC suspended
367.article_body: The DGCA has suspended an air traffic controller's (ATCO) licence for three months for approving simultaneous departures of two IndiGo flights at Bengaluru airport on January 7, which led to the planes averting a mid-air collision just after their take off. At the closest point of conflict, the vertical and lateral separation between both aircraft was 100 feet, said DGCA.

368.title: No monkeypox cases in India as 3 samples test negative: Reports
368.article_body: All three samples tested for monkeypox in India in the past 10 days have turned out negative, reports stated. "India has no laboratory-confirmed case of monkeypox so far," a central government official reportedly said, as quoted by HT. "All the samples referred to the National Institute of Virology so far have tested negative," the official added.

369.title: 8 security personnel booked for 'murdering' tribal man in Jharkhand
369.article_body: Jharkhand Police registered an FIR against eight security personnel for "murdering" a tribal man in Latehar and "destroying the evidence" a year ago. Police had earlier claimed the alleged murder was an incident of "crossfire". Police had said they encountered the tribals with arms and the other members of the group had said they carried a country-made gun for hunting.

370.title: Woman jumps into well with her 6 children in Maharashtra; she survives, all children die
370.article_body: A 30-year-old woman in Maharashtra's Raigad jumped into a well along with her six children following a domestic dispute, police said. The woman survived but all her children, aged between 18 months and 10 years, died. The deceased children included five girls. An official said the woman took the step after she was allegedly beaten up by her husband's family.

371.title: Man seen throwing cash while driving car in viral video from Noida; police post his apology
371.article_body: A man's car was seized after he was seen swinging a baseball bat and throwing cash while driving the vehicle in UP's Noida. Police posted the man's apology on Twitter. "If you do stunts on the road, we will hunt. The vehicle will be confiscated, you will be in a lock-up," UP Police tweeted in Hindi.

372.title: Huge crowd gathers as Moosewala's mortal remains brought home, pics surface
372.article_body: A huge crowd gathered near Sidhu Moosewala's home as the late singer-politician's mortal remains were brought home from the hospital ahead of his funeral. Moosewala's fans were heard shouting slogans against the Punjab government and the police, demanding death for his murderers. Moosewala was shot dead on Sunday.

373.title: Man's fight to get ₹35 refund from Railways helps 2.98 lakh people get ₹2.43 crore
373.article_body: A man, who filed nearly 50 RTI applications to get back ₹35 charged as service tax by Railways despite cancelling his ticket before GST regime was implemented, has helped 2.98 lakh people get ₹2.43 crore in refunds. An IRCTC official informed Sujeet Swami that the process to deposit refund is underway and all the passengers would gradually receive their refund.

374.title: There are no doubts, Karim Benzema should win Ballon d'Or: Messi
374.article_body: Lionel Messi has said that Real Madrid's Karim Benzema deserves to win the Ballon d'Or this year. "Benzema had a spectacular year...He was fundamental in all the matches [in Champions League] from the round of 16 onwards. I think there is no doubt this year," stated Messi. Benzema scored 44 goals with 15 assists in all competitions this season.

375.title: 2nd FIR filed against BJP's Nupur Sharma over remarks on Prophet
375.article_body: Days after an FIR was filed in Mumbai against BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma over her remarks on the Prophet Muhammad during a TV debate, a second case was registered against her in Thane on Monday. The complaint was made by a madrassa teacher who claimed that Sharma's comments on the Prophet and his wife hurt his religious sentiments.

376.title: European Council to commit $9.7 billion in aid to Ukraine
376.article_body: The European Union Council (EUCO) is ready to give Ukraine €9 billion ($9.7 billion) amid Russian invasion, EU Council President Charles Michel said on Tuesday. The council will continue to help Kyiv with its "immediate liquidity needs" alongside the G7 countries, he added. Michel called EUCO's grant of €9 billion a "strong and concrete support to Ukraine's reconstruction".

377.title: Not important, just glorified friendlies: De Bruyne on Nations League
377.article_body: Manchester City midfielder Kevin De Bruyne said the UEFA Nations League is "not important", adding that he considers the matches in the tournament as "just glorified" friendlies. "I am not looking forward to it," stated De Bruyne. "In 12 months, we have three weeks of holiday...It doesn't even matter to mention it, nothing will change anyway," said De Bruyne.

378.title: Fire breaks out at plastic factory in Noida, no injuries reported
378.article_body: A fire broke out at a private factory manufacturing plastic goods in Noida on Tuesday morning. No casualties or injuries have been reported in the incident. "The fire was reported around 4 am, prompting a quick deployment of firefighters...Five water tenders were rushed to the site and the blaze was brought under control by 6 am," an officer said.

379.title: Hyderabad Police chief meets family of man killed over inter-caste marriage
379.article_body: Hyderabad Police Commissioner CV Anand on Monday met the family of Neeraj Panwar who was allegedly killed over his inter-caste marriage on May 20. "We'll liaison with court officials to expedite...trials...and ensure conviction is achieved at the earliest," Anand said. In the meeting, organised with members of both the caste, Anand urged the communities to stop targeting each other.

380.title: Over 70,000 petrol pump dealers in 24 states/UTs to not buy fuel from oil firms today
380.article_body: Over 70,000 petrol pump dealers across 24 states and UTs will not purchase fuel from oil companies on Tuesday to protest against the lack of hike in dealer commission. "There was an agreement between companies and dealer associations that dealer margins will be revised every six months. However, it hasn't been revised since 2017," Delhi Petroleum Dealers' Association President said.

381.title: Kashi, Mathura not on our agenda, it is for courts to decide: Nadda
381.article_body: Speaking on the ongoing mosque-temple disputes, BJP chief JP Nadda said that contentious religious matters such as reclaiming temples in Kashi and Mathura are not on BJP's agenda. "We have always talked about the cultural development of the country. But these issues will be decided by courts and the Constitution...and BJP will implement it in letter and spirit," Nadda added.

382.title: 200 Durga Vahini women booked for marching with weapons in Kerala
382.article_body: Around 200 members of Durga Vahini, the women's wing of Vishva Hindu Parishad, have been booked for allegedly taking out a march carrying weapons in Kerala's Thiruvananthapuram. A video of the march, which was allegedly held as part of arms training, has surfaced on social media. The women are facing various charges including unlawful assembly and rioting.

383.title: I wish I can be a man: 19-yr-old Zheng on battling menstrual cramps in French Open defeat
383.article_body: China's 19-year-old tennis player Qinwen Zheng blamed her French Open women's singles round of 16 defeat against world number one Iga Świątek on menstrual cramps. She said, "The first day is always..tough and then I've to do sport and I always have so much pain on...first day...I wish I can be a man...so I don't have to suffer from this."

384.title: Actress Dipti Dhyani shaves head after husband Sooraj Thapar recovers from COVID
384.article_body: Actress Dipti Dhyani has shaved her head for her actor-husband Sooraj Thapar. She had vowed to offer her hair at Tirupati Balaji while Sooraj was in ICU last year, after contracting COVID-19. Talking to ETimes, Dipti said, "I felt helpless when...doctors [said]...60 per cent of his lungs were infected...I prayed to every God...I also...vowed to donate my hair to...Tirupati Balaji."

385.title: BJP creates controversies, you stay silent: Abhishek Banerjee to WB Guv
385.article_body: TMC MP Abhishek Banerjee on Monday accused West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar of remaining silent when BJP leaders make controversial statements and insult CM Mamata Banerjee. His comments came after Dhankhar accused Abhishek Banerjee of "crossing the red line" by criticising judiciary. Banerjee claimed that BJP leaders Dilip Ghosh, Biplab Deb and others have also criticised the judiciary.

386.title: SUGAR Cosmetics raises $50 mn, reportedly at $500 mn valuation
386.article_body: Direct-to-consumer beauty and personal care brand SUGAR Cosmetics has raised $50 million in Series D funding led by L Catterton. Others who participated in the funding include existing investors A91 Partners, Elevation Capital and India Quotient. This round has valued the company at $500 million, media reports said citing sources. SUGAR had raised $21 million in February 2021.

387.title: Akshay takes dip in Ganga, performs aarti ahead of Prithviraj release
387.article_body: Akshay Kumar took a dip in the river Ganga during his visit to Varanasi for 'Samrat Prithviraj' promotions. The actor also performed puja with co-star Manushi Chhillar and director Dr Chandraprakash Dwivedi on the banks of river Ganga. Manushi took to Instagram to share some pictures and wrote, "Har Har Mahadev." 'Samrat Prithviraj' will release in theatres on June 3.

388.title: Tobacco kills 80 lakh people every year: WHO on World No Tobacco Day
388.article_body: Tobacco kills over 80 lakh people every year, said the World Health Organization (WHO) on the occasion of World No Tobacco Day on Tuesday. It added that 60 crore trees are chopped down and 2,200 crore tonnes of water is used to make cigarettes. "Tobacco is not only poisoning people, it's poisoning our planet," it said.

389.title: Kartik picks Rajpal in his arms at 'Bhool...' success party, video viral
389.article_body: A video of Kartik Aaryan picking up Rajpal Yadav at the 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' success party has gone viral on social media. The video was posted by a media account on Instagram. A user commented, "So adorable." Another user wrote, "Rajpal Yadav is the star of the film." 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' crossed ₹100 crore at the domestic box office.

390.title: Tourists, others organise cleanliness drive near Kedarnath after PM’s appeal
390.article_body: Tourists, government and non-government agencies organised a cleanliness drive on Tuesday near Kedarnath Dham after PM Narendra Modi appealed to people to ensure cleanliness at pilgrimage sites. "Will continuously monitor situation of waste management," Mayur Dixit, Rudraprayag DM, said. PM Modi on Sunday said if we go on a holy pilgrimage and witness a heap of filth, it's not right.

391.title: Found 100 open manholes in Mumbai, BMC creating death traps: AAP
391.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) claimed that it had found 100 open manholes in nine administrative wards of Mumbai and said that BMC was creating "death traps" for Mumbaikars. The party asked BMC to cover the manholes within a week and said, "It is shameful that every year the BMC refuses to do its duty and fix open manholes."

392.title: Monkeypox no reason to shun LGBTQ+ Pride parades: WHO
392.article_body: World Health Organization (WHO) has said that the unusual spread of monkeypox doesn't mean people should shun LGBTQ+ Pride parades this summer. "Most of these events - the official events - are outdoors, they're family-friendly. We don't see any real reason to be concerned about the enhanced likelihood of transmission in those contexts," Andy Seale, a WHO adviser, said.

393.title: Hogg picks his best XI of IPL 2022, names Hardik Pandya as captain
393.article_body: Ex-Australia spinner Brad Hogg has picked his best XI of IPL 2022 with Hardik Pandya as the captain. Hogg picked Jos Buttler and David Warner as openers with Rahul Tripathi at number three position. He further picked David Miller, Dinesh Karthik, Ravichandran Ashwin and Rashid Khan. Hogg named Jasprit Bumrah, Mohammad Shami and Harshal Patel as his pacers.

394.title: Umar Khalid's Amravati speech in bad taste, not terrorist act: Delhi HC
394.article_body: Former JNU student Umar Khalid's Amravati speech in "bad taste" does not make it a "terrorist act", Delhi HC said. "If the case of the prosecution is premised on how offensive the speech was, that by itself will not constitute an offence," HC added. Khalid is accused under Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act in connection with Delhi riots 'larger conspiracy' case.

395.title: Himachal govt announces free domestic water for rural areas
395.article_body: Himachal Pradesh government has made drinking water free in all rural regions of the state. Accordingly, no bill will be charged from the consumers in rural areas of the state after May 1 for domestic water supply. The move will benefit about 11.5 lakh consumers. Two months ago, the state government announced 125 units of free electricity to consumers.

396.title: India's import of discounted Russian crude oil touches record high in May
396.article_body: India imported a record high of over 24 million barrels of discounted Russian crude oil in May, up from 7.2 million barrels in April. India has received 34 million barrels of Russian oil since the Ukraine war began, data showed. This has trebled the value of total imports from Russia, including other products, compared with the same period of 2021.

397.title: My era at Bayern is over, no chance of continuing: Robert Lewandowski
397.article_body: Bayern Munich striker Robert Lewandowski said his "era" at the club is over, adding that there is "no chance" of him continuing his career at Bayern anymore. "I hope that they don't keep me just because they can," stated Lewandowski. "I don't want to play there anymore. A transfer is the best solution," said Lewandowski.

398.title: Traffic police working on setting speed limits on Gurugram's major roads
398.article_body: In order to curb accidents, the Gurugram Traffic Police is soon going to set speed limits for the city's major roads. A safety audit in this regard, which is conducted by the government officials and other experts, will be completed soon. Notably, several of Gurugram's arterial roads don't have a speed limit, which often results in accidents, officials said.

399.title: Satyendar Jain arrested in fake case, to be out soon: Manish Sisodia
399.article_body: AAP's Manish Sisodia said Delhi minister Satyendar Jain, who was arrested by ED in alleged money laundering case, will be out soon as the case is "totally fake". "ED had stopped calling him for some time...Now, it has again started calling him because he is the (AAP) incharge of the Himachal polls," he added.

400.title: Russia suspends gas supplies to Dutch govt-owned power firm
400.article_body: Russia's Gazprom has decided to suspend its gas supplies to the Dutch government-owned power firm GasTerra from Tuesday (May 31) after the latter refused to make payment in roubles. However, the Dutch government said the move will have "no consequences [on] the physical delivery of gas to Dutch households". GasTerra said it has secured a gas deal elsewhere.

401.title: UP govt will file cases against farmers who abandon cows: Minister
401.article_body: Uttar Pradesh minister Dharam Pal Singh said in the state Assembly on Monday that CM Yogi Adityanath-led government has enacted a law to register cases against farmers who abandon cows. "There is a difference between 'kasai and kisan' (butcher and farmer). We will care for the farmer, not the butcher," he added. Furthermore, he said that cows "aren't stray animals".

402.title: Canada plans to ban handgun sales in wake of Texas school shooting
402.article_body: Canadian PM Justin Trudeau's government has introduced legislation that would put a freeze on importing, buying or selling handguns. "Other than using firearms for sport shooting and hunting, there's no reason anyone in Canada should need guns in their everyday lives," Trudeau said. The legislation comes days after a gunman killed 19 children at an elementary school in US' Texas.
